title: China Seas
actors: Jean Harlow, Clark Gable, Wallace Beery, Rosalind Russell
description: Although his jealous mistress is on board, the captain of a ferry traveling between Hong Kong and Singapore is engaged to a rich widow. To get revenge, the girl gives a bandit the keys to the armory of the ship that is attacked by the pirates, who, however, are unable to seize the cargo of gold. Justice will triumph.
notes: Thwarted loves, strong passions, pirate raids in the South Seas: if we tried to define the idea of ??"classicism" in the system of genres, this film would provide an ideal synthesis. A simple but well-cooked recipe, with all the ingredients in the right place, as today we can do more and more rarely.

title: The Haunted
actors: Jeffrey DeMunn, Sally Kirkland, Louise Latham, Joyce Van Patten
description: A small family from Pennsylvania moves into a new home where a series of terrifying phenomena soon unfold. Between movements of objects, noises, frightening voices and so on, they must fight above all in order not to lose their mind. The film, shot for TV, deals with events that were widely dealt with in the American news and is based on the book (1988 best-seller) in which the protagonist family narrated their experience. The realization has some effectiveness.

title: Dead Awake
actors: Lori Petty, Jesse Bradford, Brea Grant, Jocelin Donahue, Jesse Borrego, James Eckhouse, Billy Blair, Liz Mikel, Mona Lee Fultz, Jeffrey Reddick
description: Young Kate Bowman is a social worker who is investigating the mysterious deaths of some people while they were sleeping. Shortly before his death, the victims reported seeing something supernatural while suffering some kind of sleep paralysis. Investigating further, Kate ends up provoking the force of the evil entity at the origin of it all, which will attempt to target her and her family.

title: Mr. Stitch
actors: Rutger Hauer, Will Wheaton, Romland Wafford, Nia Peeples
description: Dr. Archibald Rus is the head of a government science agency. His work consists in the experimentation of a surgical system capable of recreating a man made up of parts of eighty different bodies. Lazarus, this is the creature's name, should have neither a will nor a memory; instead he is shocked every night by the horrendous images of the deaths suffered by the owners of the bodies used in his creation.
notes: Second film as director of Roger Avary, screenwriter with Quentin Tarantino of "Pulp Fiction". A television horror, which cannot therefore exceed too much, however well directed.

title: Cross 2
actors: Brian Austin Green, Danny Trejo, Vinnie Jones, Patrick Durham, Tom Sizemore, Lori Heuring, Tim Abell, André Gordon, Ned Liebl, Amy Jane
description: The city of Los Angeles is in danger, an old Viking demon named Gunnar has been brought back to life by a curse. Only Cross and his team of fighters will be able to save the city and restore order to the world.

title: Eye of the Tiger
actors: Gary Busey, Yaphet Kotto, Seymour Cassel
description: Buck Matthews returns home from jail. All that matters in his life is the love of his wife Christie and their little Jennifer. But his return soon turns into a war: a gang of bikers kill Christie in revenge and reduce Jennifer to death. From that moment on Buck seeks only his revenge together with his friend J.B. Deveraux, aide to the sheriff.
notes: Sarafian had her golden moment a long time ago with films like "White Man Go With Your God". But to make a living, however, he was really bad, forced to direct stuff like this similjustiziere of the night: an hour and a half of unpretentious action.

title: Rosewood Lane
actors: Rose McGowan, Lauren Vélez, Ray Wise, Bill Fagerbakke, Lesley-Anne Down, Lin Shaye, Rance Howard, Ashton Moio, Judson Mills, Steve Tom
description: Sonny Blake, a psychiatrist who dispenses advice from the microphones of a radio talk show, decides after the death of his alcoholic father to return to the house where he spent his childhood. As soon as she arrives, she realizes how the whole neighborhood is terrified of Derek Barber, the boy who delivers the newspapers in the morning and who has a habit of turning children's nursery rhymes into macabre omens of what could happen, convincing himself that behind the death of the parent there is her hand and that she is the next intended victim. Since no one seems to give rise to her words and the evidence gathered against Derek is insufficient to initiate a police investigation, Sonny is forced to face her fears alone, ending up the protagonist of a grueling hunt in which she is the one the prey.

title: Alice in Wonderland
actors: Mia Wasikowska, Johnny Depp, Anne Hathaway, Michael Sheen, Helena Bonham Carter, Alan Rickman, Crispin Glover, Christopher Lee, Eleanor Tomlinson, Matt Lucas, Geraldine James, Frances de la Tour, Eleanor Gecks, Michael Gough, Imelda Staunton
description: Alice is a seventeen-year-old who refuses an arranged marriage and dreams of becoming an industry captain. Fleeing the party where it was supposed to be presented in society, she finds herself in a very strange world, populated by fantastic creatures. There he will find the always late white rabbit, the mad hatter, the white queen and the red one.
notes: Burton reinterprets the character of Lewis Carroll by presenting a more adult version and appeals to all the phantasmagoric paraphernalia of his cinema, with the inevitable feeling of déjà vu. _Alice in Wonderland_ seems to favor Disney production more (with a fake 3D) than the director and fails to distil the true essence of the original.

title: Re-Animator
actors: Jeffrey Combs, Bruce Abbott, Barbara Crampton, Robert Sampson
description: A medical student invents a serum to resurrect the dead. But the corpses come back to life for the purpose of killing.
notes: Gordon's directorial debut, who began his film career with one of the most violent and revolting films of the 1980s, with no regard for anyone: a worthy heir to Romero. A joy. From a story by H.P. Lovecraft. Considered a cult movie by fans of the horror genre.

title: The Outrage
actors: Paul Newman, Laurence Harvey, Claire Bloom, Edward G. Robinson
description: Accused of killing a man and raping his wife, Juan Carrasco is sentenced to death. He says it was a regular duel. Some support the suicide thesis, others blame (at least morally) the wickedness of the wife and the wife finally contradicts everyone by accusing herself of the murder. Too many versions for a single crime cause despair over the possibility of finding the truth. Martin Ritt puts the subject of "Rashomon", a famous film by Akira Kurosawa, into a western. The transposition fails completely and smells a little academy. However, the actors are splendid: from Paul Newman to Edward G. Robinson.

title: A Knight's Tale
actors: Heath Ledger, Mark Addy, Rufus Sewell, Shannyn Sossamon, Alan Tudyk
description: Squire William would like to take a step forward and become a knight. The opportunity presents itself to him when he accidentally meets a man who in exchange for clothes and food gives him documents that can make him pass as a noble. So on the death of the knight he serves William takes his place and fights in the tournament for the beautiful Jocelyn.
notes: Armor, knightly tournaments, court banquets, courtly love with various licenses, heirs to the throne, a talented writer, Chaucer, ruined by a passion for the game and noble girls. It would seem the return of a vein, but no one has more faith in the adventure with helmet and armor. The European challenge tour is the romance of old rodeo and the pragmatism of the tennis circus. Brian Helgeland, screenwriter of "LA Confidential" and dull director of "Payback" and "Conspiracy Hypothesis" for his excursion into the Middle Ages is accompanied by a pressing soundtrack (among others, Queen, Eric Clapton and AC / DC) without having the courage or the imagination to twist the plot towards a pop-rock musical, he manipulates, in some scenes, the make-up and costumes as if he wanted to take the characters to the disco and stops at the door. A series of indecisions that are reflected in the unmotivated 132 minutes of a film in which the strong moments (the tournaments) weaken in the repetition of images and the clash of weapons.

title: The Terror
actors: Boris Karloff, Jack Nicholson, Sandra Knight, Dick Miller
description: The French officer André Duvalier meets a mysterious woman whom he then recognizes in the portrait of Baron von Leppe's wife, who, however, should have been dead for many years. Duvalier learns that she was murdered by the baron: what he saw is a simulacrum resulting from a curse ...
notes: In the wake of the series inspired by the stories of Edgar Allan Poe, Corman insists on the gothic atmosphere of cursed castles, where intricate family curses roam. Old glory Boris Karloff plays Baron von Leppe; among the assistant directors is a young man who will go a long way: Francis Ford Coppola.

title: Time Trap
actors: Andrew Wilson, Cassidy Gifford, Brianne Howey, Reiley McClendon, Olivia Draguicevich, Max Wright, Sabin Smith, Rich Skidmore, Chris Sturgeon, Hans Marrero
description: An archeology professor disappears after entering a cave. Some of his students go after him and discover a cave where time flows differently than the surface.

title: One Tough Bastard
actors: Brian Bosworth, Bruce Payne, DeJuan Guy, Jeff Kober, Lawrence Lowe
description: John North is a Marine officer whose family is slaughtered by a gang of arms traffickers in a drugstore. Recovering from the shock, he tries in vain to track down the killers, but the FBI makes him understand that his interest is not appreciated. In fact, behind the whole story, there is the hand of Karl Savak, a corrupt federal agent, who is trying to recover a shipment of high-tech weapons he promised to a drug dealer in Los Angeles.
notes: According to Lance Henriksen, the man who called John Woo a poet, Brian Bosworth is a kind of John Wayne of our time and we won't blame him.

title: The Omen
actors: Gregory Peck, Lee Remick, David Warner, Billie Whitelaw, Harry Stevens
description: He discovers that his adopted son is the antichrist, and tries to suppress him. There is show, but little originality. A truly remarkable suspense, excellent actors and a dull and suggestive photography. The film had three sequels, the first of which was The Curse of Damien.

title: Prince Charming
actors: Sean Maguire, Martin Short, Michael Boisvert, Christina Applegate, Billy Connolly, Bernadette Peters
description: An extra-marital escapade of Prince John costs dear both to him and to his usual companion in adventure: the two find themselves transformed into as many frogs, and so they will have to remain for eternity. Unless a girl agrees to first kiss and then marry the unfortunate prince-batrach ...

title: Dead Birds
actors: Henry Thomas, Patrick Fugit, Nicki Aycox, Michael Shannon, Muse Watson, Mark Boone Junior, Isaiah Washington, Harris Mann, Melanie Abramoff, Donna Biscoe
description: William leads a handful of desertering soldiers who have just robbed a bank. On the run with the loot, the gang finds refuge near a plantation on the border with Mexico, in an uninhabited house. During the night, men will discover that they are not alone and that they have to save their lives, threatened by disturbing presences.

title: Spell
actors: Omari Hardwick, Loretta Devine, Lorraine Burroughs, John Beasley, Andre Jacobs, Tumisho Masha, Peter Butler, Ri-Karlo Handy, Hannah Gonera, Kalifa Burton
description: Marquis is flying with his family to go to his father's funeral in the Appalachian countryside. A very strong storm causes the plane to lose control and crash. Marquis wakes up injured and trapped in the attic of Mrs. Eloise, a woman who claims she can cure him with a hoodoo ritual. Unable to call for help, Marquis will desperately try to outsmart the woman and free himself from her magic in order to save the family from a sinister ritual.

title: Return of Jedi
actors: Harrison Ford, Mark Hamill, Carrie Fisher, Billy Dee Williams
description: Luke Skywalker and Ian Solo are preparing for the final battle against the Empire but Luke has learned that the terrible Darth Vader, the greatest enemy of the rioters, is in fact his father. The insurrection is unsuccessful and Luke is captured by the emperor's troops, who tries to bring the young man to his side.
notes: Third (or rather sixth) and last episode of the saga conceived by George Lucas. For the twentieth anniversary, the entire trilogy has been restored and digitally remastered with the addition of unreleased sequences. In this case, a fun ballet in the palace of Jabba the Hut, new images of the "creature" of the sand and a finale full of scenes of the celebrations for the victory over the Empire.

title: Ten Wanted Men
actors: Randolph Scott, Jocelyn Brando, Richard Boone, Alfonso Bedoya, Donna Martell, Skip Homeier, Clem Bevans, Leo Gordon, Minor Watson, Lester Matthews, Tom Powers, Dennis Weaver, Lee Van Cleef
description: In the town of Okatiglia, the rivalry between the Stewarts and the Campbells flares up. When Adam Campbell is killed, his son Albert seeks revenge. Not very bad, despite the obviousness of the plot.

title: Empire
actors: John Leguizamo, Peter Sarsgaard, Denise Richards, Vincent Laresca, Isabella Rossellini, Sonia Braga, Delilah Cotto, Nestor Serrano, Anthony 'Treach' Criss, Rafael Báez
description: Victor Rosa is a Latin American gangster with the ambitions of a young "godfather" and the violent ways of the man of the street. But his life of excesses comes to a halt when his girlfriend announces that she is pregnant: perhaps the time has come to settle down, but leaving the "family" is more difficult than expected. Vic believes he finds a way out when he meets Jack, an enterprising Wall Street broker who could help him quadruple the clan's profits in just six months ...
notes: The plot is classic, but the characters are sketchy, the script is chaotic, and the film doesn't fly any higher than usual punches-and-guns.

title: Escapee
actors: Dominic Purcell, Christine Evangelista, Melissa Ordway, Danny Nucci, Scott Elrod, Kadeem Hardison, Carly Chaikin, Justin Gaston, David Jensen, Faith Ford
description: Visiting a local psychiatric hospital with her class, young psychology student Abby Jones is troubled by a close encounter with one of the high-risk patients, Harmon. Back home, she is preparing for an evening of study with her roommates when, during the stormy night that follows, Harmon runs away from the hospital, spreading a trail of death to get closer to her. To warn Abby and her companions of the danger they run is the policeman Carter Thomas.

title: Blade Runner
actors: Harrison Ford, Sean Young, Rutger Hauer, Daryl Hannah, Edward James Olmos, M. Emmet Walsh, Brion James, William Sanderson, Joe Turkel, Joanna Cassidy
description: We are in Los Angeles, swarming and immense, in the near future: a former police detective, specializing in the hunting and "withdrawal" of rebel replicants, is called back into service to find four, escaped from an extraterrestrial colony. After the mission his life is completely changed. After the success he had with the first "Alien", Ridley Scott returns to science fiction, however, mixing it with the noir atmospheres of the forties detective stories. The result is fascinating: for the labyrinthine, suffocating sets, for the rough melancholy of the story, for the superb presence of Harrison Ford. This version of the film is the one desired by the director without the cuts imposed by the production.

title: To Die For
actors: Brendan Hughes, Amanda Wyss, Scott Jacoby, Steve Bond

title: Satan's Sadists
actors: Russ Tamblyn, Scott Brady, John 'Bud' Cardos, Robert Dix, Gary Kent, Greydon Clark, Kent Taylor, Regina Carrol, Jacqueline Cole, William Bonner
description: Plot in preparation

title: The Gore Gore Girls
actors: Frank Kress, Amy Farrell, Hedda Lubin, Henny Youngman
description: Detective Abraham Gentry investigates the crimes of some topless bar dancers. After a roundup of imaginative murders, Gentry unmasks the serial killer.

title: Chato's Land
actors: Charles Bronson, Jack Palance, James Withmore, Richard Basehart
description: We are in New Mexico, in 1873, a time and a place in which, for a "half-breed", killing a white sheriff, albeit in self-defense, means condemning oneself to persecution and flight. This is what happens to Chato (Bronson), half white and half Apache. When the pursuers attack his family, Chato thinks back, decides to face them and takes them down one by one. The Winner-Bronson duo, for once on vacation from the saga of the "executioner of the night", moves to the West and builds a film substantially identical to the others. Good craft, a good dose of violence and, thank goodness, a good cast.

title: Wonder Woman 1984
actors: Gal Gadot, Chris Pine, Kristen Wiig, Pedro Pascal, Robin Wright, Connie Nielsen, Lilly Aspell
description: Wonder Woman is faced in 1984 with two entirely new enemies: the super villain Cheetah and Max Lord. Fortunately, he will once again have the handsome driver Steve Trevor at his side.

title: Saddle the Wind
actors: Robert Taylor, John Cassavetes, Julie London, Donald Crisp
description: Tony returns to the farm that his brother Steve has been running in his absence. The two brothers love each other but have a very different character: Tony is bossy at least as much as Steve is reasonable. So the reactions of the two towards the claims of the cowboys are different: Steve is willing to negotiate while Tony confronts them with the gun in his hand. Found guilty of murder, Tony runs away hunted by the sheriff: once joined by a group of men including Steve, he will prefer suicide to capture. It is the character of John Cassavetes (future director and here an excellent actor), to make the difference between this western and the others of the period. Screenplay by Rod Serling, smart and modern.

title: Mimic
actors: Mira Sorvino, Jeremy Northam, Alexander Goodwin, Giancarlo Giannini, Josh Brolin
description: An old urban legend told of an albino alligator in the sewer and ravines of the New York subway. Exactly what happens, this time seriously, in the subway that is filled with gigantic insects created by a genetic experiment. The responsible is a scientist (Mira Sorvino) who, with a variously assorted "heroic patrol" has to fight with the ravenous cockroaches, whose main power is that of mimicry.
notes: If the "denied" motherhood of the protagonist (she "gave birth" to the beasts in the laboratory and, almost as a retaliation, she cannot have children) makes so much Aliens (but with less intensity), most of the twists are a bit obvious . but the atmosphere works. And then Guillermo Del Toro uses Rob Bottin's sickening monsters to fill the scene.

title: VFW
actors: Stephen Lang, Martin Kove, William Sadler, Sierra McCormick, David Patrick Kelly, Dora Madison, George Wendt, Fred Williamson, Travis Hammer, Tom Williamson
description: In the near future, a new drug called Hype has turned America into a war zone. Addicts are more mutants than humans. In this context, a group of Vietnam veterans gather to celebrate the birthday of Fred, one of them. That same evening, however, in Boz, the notorious trafficker of their area, a drug consignment is stolen by a woman named Lizard, who takes refuge among her old ex-military companions. Ready for anything to recover his precious Hype, Boz will unleash his army of henchmen.

title: Frontier Rangers
actors: Keith Larsen, Buddy Ebsen, Don Brunett
description: Major Rogers, escaping an Indian ambush, identifies a traitor white and has him executed. Then he goes to the camp of the Black Wolf chief and challenges him to a duel. Jacques Tourneur directs a dignified collage of two television episodes. Tourneur did a lot better.

title: Badman's Country
actors: George Montgomery, Buster Crabbe
description: To fight Butch Cassidy, Sheriff Pat Garret enlists the help of colleagues Wyatt Earp and Bat Masterson, and Buffalo Bill. The famous names of the western are all there. But the western is modest and a bit confusing.

title: Catch .44
actors: Bruce Willis, Forest Whitaker, Nikki Reed, Michael Rosenbaum, Brad Dourif, Deborah Ann Woll, Malin Akerman, Shea Whigham, Edrick Browne, Jimmy Lee Jr., P.J. Marshall
description: Tes (Malin Akerman), Kara (Nikki Reed) and Dawn (Deborah Ann Woll), three criminals looking for the chance of their life, are hired by the evil Mel (Bruce Willis), an opportunistic drug boss, who entrusts them with a delicate task to complete. Along the way, the three girls face many difficulties caused primarily by a dangerous killer (Forest Whitaker) who moves in the uniform of a policeman killed long ago. To create further problems comes the certainty of having been scammed by Mel: now, however, they can no longer hold back and are somehow forced to carry out their mission.

title: Indigenous
actors: Zachary Soetenga, Lindsey Mckeon, Sofia Pernas, Pierson Fode, Jamie Anderson, Juanxo Villaverde, Laura Penuela, Jaime Newball, Yana Galuz
description: Five American friends travel to Panama to relax and finally spend some time together. Here, they befriend a local woman and, despite some disturbing rumors, she breaks her brother's instructions and takes the group on a trip to pristine jungle waterfalls. What begins as an innocent hike will take a terrifying turn as friends realize as night approaches that they are being followed by the legendary bloodthirsty chupacabra.

title: Bowery at Midnight
actors: Bela Lugosi, John Archer, Wanda McKay, Dave O'Brien, Lew Kelly
description: In the infamous New York neighborhood of Bowery, there is a shelter for destitute people where Professor Brenner also lends his work. He is a teacher from the local college, but he leads a double life: at night, stripping off his respectable professional clothes, he turns into a ruthless killer. He then throws his victims into a basement where a strange zombie people live. But even the "professor" will have a bad end.
notes: Defined by critics as shaky, Wallace W. Fox's horror films nevertheless remain the cornerstones of the unrepeatable B movie season. Fox is a master of atmosphere, thanks to a lugubrious Bela Lugosi at the right point.

title: End of a Gun
actors: Steven Seagal, Danny Trejo, Alexandre Nguyen, Ovidiu Nicolescu, Claudiu Bleont, Troy Miller, Andrei Ciopec, George Remes, Lavinia Geambasu, Radu Andrei Micu, Florin Piersic Jr., Jade Ewen
description: Decker, a former federal agent, runs into Lisa but is forced to kill her violent boyfriend to save her. Knowing the risks that Decker has taken, Lisa proposes that he steal the two million euros hidden in her boyfriend's car seized by the police. The money, however, should have been handed over to a dangerous drug lord. To avoid the worst, Decker will find an unlikely ally in a security guard.

title: Dark Command
actors: John Wayne, Claire Trevor, Walter Pidgeon, Roy Rogers, George 'Gabby' Gays
description: Defeated by Texan cowboy Bob Seton in both the race for the position of sheriff and in the race for the heart of the beautiful Mary McCloud, Will Cantrell gives up the profession of teacher and takes advantage of the outbreak of the Civil War to form a gang of renegades, apparently affiliated with the Southerners but in reality devoted to robberies and raids. Refreshed by the new situation, the rivalry between Cantrell and Seton will end up going on for a long time ...
notes: Despite the cuts imposed by the Republic, which greatly irritated Walsh, the film - based on a novel by W.R. Burnett and inspired by the exploits of the infamous William Quantrill - remains on dignified levels.

title: Phantasm
actors: Angus Scrimm, Reggie Bannister, Michael Baldwin, Bill Thornbury

title: Wheelman
actors: Frank Grillo, Garret Dillahunt, Wendy Moniz, Caitlin Carmichael, Slaine, John Cenatiempo, William Xifaras
description: An experienced criminal escape driver finds himself having to survive after a bank robbery gone horribly wrong. With a car full of money and his family in danger, he knows it's too late to figure out who betrayed him and realizes that the only person he can trust is his 14-year-old daughter.

title: 22 Jump Street
actors: Channing Tatum, Jonah Hill, Peter Stormare, Wyatt Russell, Amber Stevens, Jillian Bell, Ice Cube, Jimmy Tatro, Nick Offerman, Rob Riggle, Dave Franco, Dax Flame, Johnny Pemberton, Joe Chrest
description: After returning on an undercover mission to a high school, more big surprises await young officers Schmidt (Jonah Hill) and Jenko (Channing Tatum) when they go undercover at a local college. But when Jenko finds a kindred spirit on the football team and Schmidt infiltrates the bohemian art scene, their partnership begins to be questioned. They will find themselves not only having to solve the new case but also having to figure out which direction to take to their relationship.
notes: Lord & Miller raise their craft to power, making the hyper-aware shooting of models / characters / dynamics a springboard for countless sequels, the ineptitude of the figures put on the field - bodies with a grandiose comic range - is reaffirmed until the emanation in tangible form of the guiding spirit (Seth Rogen). Sequel to 21 Jump Street (2012).

title: Wildlike
actors: Ella Purnell, Ann Dowd, Bruce Greenwood, Nolan Gerard Funk, Brian Geraghty, Diane Farr, Joshua Leonard, Russell Josh Peterson, Skadi, Erin Lindsay King
description: Nackenzie (Ella Purnell) is a 14-year-old girl who, following the death of her father and hospitalization of her mother, is sent to stay with her uncle (Brian Geraghty) in Juneau, Alaska. After being molested by her uncle, she runs away from home: she will embark on an adventure with a kind of tramp (Bruce Greenwood), an elderly man and widower, through the wilderness of Alaska.

title: Cattle Empire
actors: Joel McCrea, Gloria Talbot, Don Haggerty, Phyllis Coates

title: Brimstone
actors: Rod Cameron, Walter Brennan, Lorna Gray, Forrest Tucker, Jack Holt, Jim Davis, James Brown, Guinn 'Big Boy' Williams, Jack Lambert, Will Wright
description: A government inspector arrives in Oklahoma to bring a criminal to justice.

title: The Mummy
actors: Tom Cruise, Annabelle Wallis, Sofia Boutella, Jake Johnson, Russell Crowe, Courtney B. Vance, Marwan Kenzari
description: Although buried in a forgotten crypt deep in the desert, a queen of antiquity awakens to the present day bringing with her anger heightened over millennia and terrors beyond human understanding. From the sands of the Middle East through hidden labyrinths, it will reach London ...

title: Beneath
actors: Daniel Zovatto, Bonnie Dennison, Chris Conroy, Jonny Orsini, Griffin Newman, Mackenzie Rosman, Mark Margolis, Emily D. Haley
description: Six high school friends decide to celebrate their graduation with an excursion to the area of ??an isolated lake. Things take a turn for the worse when they find themselves confronted with a deadly underwater predator who tests their friendship in an extreme struggle for survival. With the boat out of order, the six friends will try to find a way to return to shore and decide which of them should be sacrificed.

title: Invisible Invaders
actors: John Agar, Jean Byron, Philip Tonge, Robert Hutton, John Carradine, Hal Torey, Paul Langton, Eden Hartford
description: The aliens contact the scientist Adam Penner, informing him that they have been on the moon for twenty thousand years but have never been discovered by man thanks to their invisibility. If the earthly people do not immediately surrender to their will, humanity will be exterminated. Once on planet Earth, these beings bring the corpses back to life and take possession of their bodies. Together with his daughter, an army commander and Dr. Carol Noyman, Penner will try to stop them.

title: Interrogation
actors: Adam Copeland, C.J. Perry, Julia Benson, Erica Carroll, Patrick Sabongui, Michael Rogers, Kevin McNulty, Mitchell Kummen, Bob Frazer, Kwesi Ameyaw
description: After the FBI receives a threat that endangers the entire city, Lucas Nolan, interrogator, and computer technology specialist Becky, are due to the plan of a criminal strategist, protagonists of a race against time to prevent their moves and protect thousands of lives.

title: Last Man Standing
actors: Bruce Willis, Christopher Walken, Leslie Mann, Bruce Dern
description: Jericho, state of Texas, 1931. A frontier town with a rapidly declining population. The latest cowboys have given way to tweed-clad mobsters from hot Chicago. They arrive driven by the need to control the illegal liquor trade arriving from neighboring Mexico. In the city, two rival gangs, headed by Doyle and Strozzi, rule. One day a mysterious stranger arrives who calls himself Smith. He is kind, cynical and elusive, but he is perfectly aware of the evil that dominates the city ...
notes: Modern, deafening and angry Western with a gold cameo by Christopher Walken. Its weak side is the inexpressiveness of Bruce Willis.

title: Hunger
actors: Lori Heuring, Linden Ashby, Joe Egender, Lea Kohl, Julian Rojas, Bjorn Johnson, Britton Partain, Laura Albyn, John Cooley, Ian Hopper
description: 5 strangers find themselves locked in an underground hole for a perverse experiment on survival skills.

title: Cybernatural
actors: Heather Sossaman, Shelley Hennig, Renee Olstead, Will Peltz, Jacob Wysocki, Courtney Halverson, Cal Barnes, Matthew Bohrer, Mickey River, Moses Jacob Storm
description: During an overnight video chat, six high school friends receive a Skype message from a classmate who killed herself exactly a year ago. At first they think this is a joke, but then they realize that they are dealing with something that is not part of this world, something that wants them dead.
notes: The world (real and, consequently, cinematic) is closed in a frame of hyperbolic virtuality, free from any hold to an outside, an after, an beyond. Our present is given by the interaction with (the protagonists) and by the observation of (the public) what happens inside. Under the productive aegis of Timur Bekmambetov, Gabriadze reflects on the filmic (and extra-film) device with a conscious contemporary conscience: what is frightening today is precisely that frame.

title: Braid
actors: Madeline Brewer, Imogen Waterhouse, Sarah Hay, Scott Cohen, Jill Dalton, Brad Calcaterra, Mauricio Ovalle
description: Petula and Tilda are two artists who, moved to New York to pursue their dreams, ended up involved in drug dealing and prostitution. One night, they lose $ 80,000 worth of drugs and only have 48 hours to pay off the debt. They then plan to carry out a robbery against Daphne, a rich friend of their agoraphobic and schizophrenic childhood who lives in the fantasy world that the three created as children. To steal her money, they will have to take part in their friend's deadly universe of hallucinations, role-playing, torture and murder.

title: Kill Switch
actors: Steven Seagal, Holly Dignard, Chris Thomas King, Michael Filipowich, Isaac Hayes, Mark Collie, Karyn Michelle Baltzer, Philip Granger, Riley Jang, Connor Jang
description: A policeman disturbed by his childhood traumas after which he has devoted his life and career to track down serial killers is sent to Memphis on a mission that will be true bread for his teeth.

title: Wanda Nevada
actors: Peter Fonda, Brooke Shields, Fiona Lewis
description: Nevada is still wild, but a couple of adventurous poker players still decide to brave the hostile environment in order to reach the Grand Canyon. Because there, between the rapids and inlets of the river, there is gold.
notes: The film is actually modest. However, he is the only one that Fonda father and Fonda son have filmed together. Since they haven't spoken to each other for years (Henry didn't forgive Peter for being "left"), _Wanda Nevada_ thus represents a moment of reconciliation between the old lion and the offspring of _Easy Rider_. Fonda Jr. as a director did better in '71 with _The Return of Harry Collings_.

title: Night of the Comet
actors: Catherine Mary Stewart, Kelli Maroney, Robert Beltran
description: The return of a comet, the same that caused the extinction of the dinosaurs in the passage of millions of years ago, almost completely destroys humanity on Earth. Among the few survivors, two bad California girls ... Tasty low cost film, tinged with irony, which reserves some good moments of thrill.

title: Vampire at Midnight
actors: Jason Williams, Lesley Milne, Robert Random
description: A famous psychiatrist, specialist in treatment with the hypnosis method, has gone so far in his research that, through the trance system on patients, he has committed a now numerous series of heinous crimes. He would continue to kill undisturbed were it not that a policeman, directly involved in a murder, begins to have suspicions about him ...
notes: The actualization of the vampire theme hardly works.

title: The Rage: Carrie 2
actors: Emily Bergl, Jason London, Dylan Bruno, Amy Irving, Mena Suvari, J. Smith-Cameron
description: Over twenty years earlier, Carrie White consumed her revenge against her schoolmates, guilty of cruelly humiliating her. Today Sue Snell, one of the few survivors of that massacre perpetrated by telekinesis, works as a social worker at a high school and is particularly dedicated to Rachel, a "problematic" student. Coincidentally, this young woman also has the ability to move objects at a distance, and that a group of bullies are planning to make fun of her. Rachel and Carrie, however, are more connected than you think ...
notes: Faint semi-sequel to De Palma's film with Sissy Spacek (1976).

title: Frankenstein
actors: Boris Karloff, Colin Clive, Mae Clarke, John Boles, Edward Van Sloan, Frederick Kerr, Dwight Frye, Lionel Belmore
description: The baron and scientist Dr. Frankenstein transplants a new brain onto a dead person and brings it back to life through the application of a magnetic fluid. But the grafted gray matter is that of a criminal madman: the creature, childish and bloodthirsty at the same time, gets rid of its guardians and begins to kill.
notes: English in Hollywood, James Whale made Mary Shelley's Frankenstein a true icon of the 20th century. It seems he was the one who invented the monster mask, even if the credit was attributed to the brilliant make-up technician Jack Pierce. Sublime Boris Karloff in the main role.

title: Contact
actors: Jodie Foster, Matthew McConaughey, James Woods, David Morse
description: As a child, Ellie Arroway would get up at night to listen to her shortwave radio with the hope of picking up mysterious voices. After her father's death she devotes herself to science, which seems to her capable of giving those answers that have always tormented her. At university, her unanswered questions prompted her to specialize in finding messages sent by extraterrestrial beings. Despite the skepticism that surrounds her, Ellie holds firm to her convictions. Until one day ...
notes: In the final part, "Contact" reveals all its splendor, thanks to the millions of dollars spent that give twenty minutes of authentic magical atmosphere up there, somewhere in the universe, where maybe you can find your loved ones walking on the beaches Florida type. The main flaw of the operation is to prepare a religious-scientific-new age cocktail without paying too much attention to measuring the ingredients. In short, the air of "Contact" is too cold, but the journey nevertheless deserves to be conducted and completed.

title: The Night House
actors: Rebecca Hall, Sarah Goldberg, Vondie Curtis-Hall, Evan Jonigkeit, Stacy Martin, Allie McCulloch, Samantha Buck, Patrick Klein, James W. Meagher, Amy Zubieta
description: A widow slowly discovers the aberrant secrets kept by her recently dead husband.

title: Conan the Destroyer
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Grace Jones, Wilt Chamberlain, Mako, Tracey Walter, Sarah Douglas, Olivia D'Abo, Pat Roach, Jeff Corey
description: In a timeless age, Queen Tamaris sends her granddaughter Jenna in search of the horn of the god Dagoth, who has long been asleep. The object assures whoever holds it dominion over the universe, but the queen secretly wants the young woman to die. To protect her, however, there is the strong Conan and, after many and dangerous adventures, the evil ones turn back on those who had put them in place, not before a monstrous metamorphosis of the idol of Dagoth.
notes: Second episode of a saga built to exalt Schwarzenegger's pectorals and biceps. Some interest in the accompanying figures and costumes. More in the frame, however, than in the painting.

title: Fighting Caravans
actors: Gary Cooper, Lili Damita, Ernest Torrence, Tully Marshall, Fred Kohler, Eugene Pallette, Roy Stewart, May Boley, Eve Southern
description: Three fusiliers escort a caravan on its way to California. Weak western in which only the star of Gary Cooper shines.

title: Black River
actors: Jay Mohr, Susan Bain, Paul Batten, Patricia Drake, Lisa Edelstein
description: A Hollywood screenwriter, Bo Aikens, arrives in the quaint town of Black River to rediscover lost inspiration. The carefree stay, thanks also to the relationship that Bo has woven with Laura, really seems to start under the best auspices. Too bad Black River hides a terrible secret.
notes: From a story by Dean Koontz.

title: Hollywood Homicide
actors: Harrison Ford, Josh Hartnett, Lena Olin, Bruce Greenwood, Lolita Davidovich, Martin Landau
description: Joe Gavilan and Kasey Calden, two detectives from the Los Angeles homicide squad, are investigating the murder of members of an up-and-coming rap group during a concert. In all likelihood, the instigator of the massacre is Sartain, a well-known producer of hip hop music, already suspected in the past of the murder of some artists who had tried to dissolve the contract with his record label ...
notes: Shelton, already a specialist in the sports sub-genre, directs something that looks like an "action movie", a film about a heterogeneous couple of detectives, a comedy, a tribute to the world of entertainment. In the end, however, it is just a flan.

title: Area 51
actors: Ben Rovner, Russ Taylor, Reid Warner, Jennefer Ludwigsen, Sandra Staggs, Roy Abramsohn, Glenn Campbell, Jelena Nik, Jonathan Marsh
description: Chris, who has always been passionate about astronomy and the world of UFOs, takes advantage of a vacation in Las Vegas to venture with friends Paul and Rob into the Nevada desert, looking for a former employee of the infamous Area 51 who can tell them about the experience. contact with extraterrestrials. Furthermore, to further increase their curiosity is the meeting with Natalie, convinced that she had been kidnapped by aliens some time before.

title: Summer's Blood
actors: Ashley Greene, Peter Mooney, Barbara Niven, Stephen McHattie, Peter Michael Dillon, Cinthia Burke, Paul Whitney, Sean Tucker
description: Summer Matthews, a rebellious teenager, discovers that her mother lied to her about her father and that he is still alive: she decides to track him down. Arriving in the small village of Massey with a photo of her parent, Summer is guilty of the theft in a shop but manages to escape the sheriff with the help of Tom Hoxey, a young man who soon discovers he is not as nice as he seems.

title: Dead Trigger
actors: Dolph Lundgren, Autumn Reeser, Romeo Miller, Isaiah Washington, Brandon Beemer, Bleona, Derek Boone, Tamara Braun, Ethan Breinholt, Toby Bronson
description: Unable to stop a virus causing a pandemic, the government develops a video game that mirrors the terrifying events that have cursed the world. The players who kill the most zombies in the game are then recruited to fight the undead in real life. Led by Captain Kyle Walker, the chosen team travels to Terminal City, where the outbreak originated, to find the team of scientists who have been working on a possible cure. The only way to get to them, however, is through a city full of terrifying zombies.

title: Second Chance
actors: Robert Mitchum, Linda Darnell, Jack Palance, Roy Roberts, Dan Seymour, Rodolfo Hoyos jr., Reginald Sheffield, Margaret Brewster, Judy Walsh, Fortunio Bonanova, Milburn Stone, Maurice Jara
description: A woman living in Mexico is sued by an American court: she is the main accusation against a gangster on trial in the United States. A killer, who has long been in love with her, is tasked with silencing her. The woman, in turn, is defended by an ex-boxer.
notes: Breathtaking story full of twists, halfway between the story of a gangster and the traditional adventure. Among the performers dominates Robert Mitchum, at ease in the role of tough with a soft heart. Mexico is hot and passionate, as is often the case in American cinema.

title: Cliffhanger
actors: Sylvester Stallone, John Lithgow, Michael Rooker, Janine Turner, Caroline Goodall
description: Traumatized by an accident in which he was unable to save a girl's life, Gabe Walker decides to do away with the mountains. However, when a plane crashes in the middle of the mountains, and he is in those parts, he cannot resist and agrees to leave in search of the survivors. He finds them immediately, but at the same time discovers that they are criminals. They take him hostage, together with another guide, to retrieve three briefcases full of dollars which, following the accident, ended up on the rocky walls and glaciers in the area. Shot halfway between Cortina and Hollywood, Harlin's film did not have the expected success. Yet there are some very impressive high-altitude footage and then there's Michael Rooker in one of his rare appearances after "Henry, Rain of Blood".

title: Army of the Dead
actors: Dave Bautista, Garret Dillahunt, Ana de la Reguera, Ella Purnell, Hiroyuki Sanada, Omari Hardwick, Theo Rossi, Tig Notaro, Lyon Beckwith, Matthias Schweighöfer
description: After a zombie invasion, Las Vegas remained in ruins and isolated from the rest of the world. When Scott Ward (Dave Bautista), former zombie war hero who now cooks burgers on the outskirts of town, is approached by casino boss Bly Tanaka (Hiroyuki Sanada), he receives an incredible proposition: enter the infested quarantine zone. zombies to recover $ 200 million buried in the casino vault before the city is bombed by the government within 32 hours. Driven by the hope that the reward will help pave the way for a reconciliation with daughter Kate (Ella Purnell), Ward accepts the challenge, putting together a disjointed team. Maria Cruz (Ana de la Reguera), a mechanic ace and old friend of Ward; Vanderohe (Omari Hardwick), a zombie killing machine; Marianne Peters (Tig Notaro), cynical helicopter pilot; Mikey Guzman (Raúl Castillo), an extravagant influencer and Chambers (Samantha Win), his ride-or-die; Martin (Garret Dillahunt), head of casino security; a daring warrior known as the Coyote (Nora Arnezeder) who recruits Burt Cummings (Theo Rossi), a slimy security guard; and a skilled German burglar named Dieter (Matthias Schweighöfer). Scott finds an unexpected emotional hurdle when Kate joins the expedition to search for Geeta (Huma Qureshi), a missing mother in the city. With the ticking of time, a notoriously impenetrable vault, and a horde of smarter, faster Alpha zombies approaching, only one thing is certain in the biggest heist ever attempted: Survivors take it all.

title: The Kid from Texas
actors: Audie Murphy, Gale Storm, Albert Dekker, Shepperd Strudwick
description: Bill is a very young Texas cowboy who, after killing a man who insulted his mother, is forced to flee. He finds refuge with a breeder, Roger, who becomes a close friend to him. Unfortunately, Roger is killed by competing breeders. Bill then vows to take revenge.

title: Polar Storm
actors: Jack Coleman, Holly Dignard, Tyler Johnston, Terry David Mulligan, Roger R. Cross, David Lewis, Rob Morton, Emma Lahana, Nicholas Carella, Marsha Regis
description: The comet named by scholars "Copernicus" seems to be heading menacingly towards the Earth. Fortunately, scientists' calculations indicate that the celestial body should not collide with the planet, but due to electromagnetic interference the risk of an impact is likely to materialize. A fragment falls on Alaska, thus unleashing a devastating storm that undermines the balance of the planet. The government tries to hide what happened due to the lack of information on the danger. Astrophysicist James Mayfield witnesses the events and together with his wife Cinthya studies the phenomenon and tries to find a solution to the problem. The population is in danger ...

title: Fire Down Below
actors: Steven Seagal, Marg Helgenberger, Stephen Lang, Brad Hunt
description: Incredible amounts of toxic substances are buried in the hilly areas of Kentucky. Responsible for this havoc is the unscrupulous opportunist Orin Hammer. The shady individual is the head of a real criminal organization. Environmentalist Jack Taggart declares war on him. Hammer and his gang are also suspected of murder. They were in fact responsible for the murder of a former colleague of Jack. If no one tries to stop them, the entire natural heritage of the American state will be completely destroyed.
notes: Steven Seagal as the environmentalist is really ridiculous.

title: Twitches
actors: Tia Mowry-Hardrict, Tamera Mowry, Kristen Wilson, Patrick Fabian
description: Twin witches Camryn and Alex, separated at birth, reunited after 21 years and saved their magical kingdom from evil and dark power. Now they try to make up for lost time and get to know each other better, perfecting their magic together and developing their powers ...

title: Totem
actors: Kerris Dorsey, Ahna O'Reilly, James Tupper, Lia McHugh, Braeden Lemasters, Lawrence Pressman, Jocelyn Ayanna, Aja Bair, Allison Caetano, Evan Dickson
description: A teenager is forced to resort to extreme measures to protect her family from a supernatural entity.

title: Piraña
actors: Bradford Dillman, Heather Menzies, Kevin McCarthy
description: The dr. Hoak has developed an unusual weapon: it is a new species of carnivorous fish that can live in both fresh and salt water. Paul and Maggie inadvertently spill them into a river; for the bloodthirsty fish the party begins, but the two responsible for the trouble are busy to make up for it.
notes: Scripted by director John Sayles, it is the second feature by the author of "Gremlins". Inspired by the "Shark", this is a catastrophic film, low budget, well written and made. Nervous style and excellent special effects strike rightly low, while a satirical subtext on the idiocy of the poeter flows.

title: Escape from New York
actors: Kurt Russell, Lee Van Cleef, Ernest Borgnine, Donald Pleasence, Harry Dean Stanton, Adrienne Barbeau
description: In the very near future the entire city of New York, now ungovernable and prey to metropolitan gangs of bandits, is transformed into a huge prison from which no one can escape. But it happens that the presidential plane, hijacked by a group of terrorists, crashes on the city. Saved by a special capsule, the first citizen of America is taken hostage by the gang of the "Duke" who, in exchange, asks for his freedom. The police then infiltrate Jena Plinski, who must complete her mission in just 24 hours.
notes: From an action film and thriller specialist like Carpenter you expect exactly what the film proposes: breathtaking pace, great emotions, apocalyptic vision. A classic of modern science fiction.

title: Day of the Badman
actors: Fred MacMurray, Joan Weldon, John Ericson
description: Four outlaws, belonging to the infamous Hayes family, arrive in a small village in the West. Their intention is to prevent the death sentence of Rud Hayes, a relative awaiting trial. For this they try to intimidate Sheriff Wiley, the jury and Judge Jim Scott himself. The citizens, terrified, would like to bow to the will of the bandits, but the sheriff disagrees. Also, Wiley's girlfriend is in love with Jim. It is a western by way and by profession, without great emotions. Incidentally, the cinemascope format is unmotivated, as the film takes place mostly indoors.

title: The Macomber Affair
actors: Gregory Peck, Joan Bennett, Robert Preston, Reginald Denny
description: A young American married couple arrives in Africa to take part in a safari. On the spot the two engage the best local hunter and with him begin their adventure. The husband wishes to redeem himself with an act of courage in the eyes of his wife, who does not consider him manly enough.
notes: Taken from the first of Hemingway's "49 tales", the film diverges from the plot of the book in the ending, which is less bitter here. Although not very original, it is a fairly direct and interpreted work.

title: Ticks
actors: Ami Dolenz, Rosalind Allen, Seth Green, Alfonso Ribeiro
description: A social worker and a sociologist organize the vacation of a group of teenagers in Northern California. The guys aren't thrilled with the idea and the follow-up proves them right. As soon as they arrive in the forest they begin to be attacked by strange mutant animals capable of sucking the saliva of the unfortunates they manage to reach. Final scene with the horde of insects marching towards the boys' hut.
notes: Yet another horror variant on the perverse nature of chemical agents that produce biological mutations: in this case it is fertilizers used to grow marijuana. What is not clear is why Randel believes he is a director.

title: The Good Old Boys
actors: Tommy Lee Jones, Sam Shepard, Sissy Spacek
description: Hewey Calloway is a mature cowboy, as proud as the land he comes from. After long wanderings, he returns to his brother Walter's farm in the endless Texas countryside. He struggles to adapt to sedentary life, also because Walter is very different from him, used as he is to the rhythms of the small town. But when it comes to taking sides against the bullying of a banker, Hewey finds in Walter a valid ally; at the same time the rude cowboy falls in love with a proud teacher.
notes: Actor Tommy Lee Jones not only stars, but makes a convincing debut as a screenwriter and director.

title: Yellowbeard
actors: Graham Chapman, Peter Boyle, Marty Feldman, Eric Idle, Cheech Marin, Tommy Chong, Peter Cook, Martin Hewitt, Michael Hordern, Madeline Kahn, James Mason, John Cleese
description: England, late 1600s. Yellowbeard, former pirate of the Jamaica Sea, manages to escape from the prisons of His British Majesty. The corsair wants to recover a treasure whose map, before being destroyed, was tattooed on the skull of his child. Except that the son is now a bold twenty and, in the treasure, many are interested.
notes: It is a comic reinterpretation - with Monty Python among the performers - of the adventurous trend of piracy. The whole is quite ramshackle, despite the merits of the historical reconstruction and some spectacular solutions. The dubbing is not very accurate either.

title: Twixt
actors: Val Kilmer, Bruce Dern, Ben Chaplin, Elle Fanning, Joanne Whalley, David Paymer, Alden Ehrenreich, Anthony Fusco, Don Novello, Ryan Simpkins
description: Hall Baltimore (Val Kilmer), writer of third-rate horror books, arrives on the presentation tour of his latest novel in a small town where he is involved by the local sheriff (Bruce Dern) in the case of the mysterious death of a young woman. girl. That same night, Hall, who has also lost a daughter, receives a visit from the ghost of another girl (Elle Fanning) who takes him around to discover old dark secrets, which reveal aspects of the past that also involve him and the writer Edgar Allan Poe (Ben Chaplin).

title: Wild Justice
actors: Roy Scheider, Patricia Millardet, Ted McGinley
description: Peter Stride is a former colonel hired by wealthy Magda Altman to track down a dangerous international terrorist: the Caliph. Things get tough quickly. First the Caliph kidnaps his daughter and then kills his best friend who helped him in the search. Peter comes to the conclusion that the Caliph is just Magda, but then comes the showdown with a final twist. Episode shortened from an American television miniseries. Full throttle guards and robbers for seen and seen adventures. Non-existent characters and childish dialogues make an operation that simply aims to fill two hours of programming on TV even more vain.

title: Ice Station Zebra
actors: Rock Hudson, Patrick McGoohan, Ernest Borgnine, Jim Brown, Tony Bill, Lloyd Nolan, Alf Kjellin, Gerald S. O'Loughlin, Ted Hartley, Murray Rose
description: James Ferraday, commander of the "Tigerfish", an American nuclear submarine, is ordered to come to the rescue of the "Arctic Base Zebra", an English weather station located in the North Pole. Forced to embark two civilians and a group of marines, the commander is right to believe that this is something other than a rescue mission. In fact, a Soviet satellite crashed in the area carrying very precious information for the CIA. Only the Russians weren't watching too ...
notes: When the war was still "cold", a good dose of healthy cinematographic anticommunism made in the USA didn't hurt. Normal war-spy show.

title: The Marksman
actors: Wesley Snipes, Emma Samms, William Hope, Anthony Warren, Peter Youngblood Hills, Ryan McCluskey, Warren Derosa, Dan Badarau, Serge Soric
description: A group of Chechen rebels occupy a thermonuclear facility and threaten to blow it up at any moment. To prevent the catastrophe, the US government hires Painter, a brave Special Forces agent, placing him in charge of a highly specialized counter-terrorist commando ...

title: Exit Wounds
actors: Steven Seagal, DMX, Anthony Anderson, Bille Duke, Isaiah Washington
description: We are in Detroit and an overly angry and taciturn cop is punished and sent to a district at risk. Fifty kilos of heroin disappear and the easy-fisted detective suspects that some colleagues are involved in the dirty business. He will fight, beyond the law, to the last move, with the help of Latrell Walker, internet genius and with a brother in jail.
notes: The pirouettes, kicks and blows (this is in a film in which the dialogue scenes are banal connections in a plot built on a frenetic progression of pure "action"), are broken up into deliberately confused images as if to mask the lost Steven Seagal's agility that needs neither asking nor acting.

title: Tha Man from Laramie
actors: James Stewart, Arthur Kennedy, Donald Crisp, Cathy O'Donnell
description: Captain Lockhart must stop an arms trade that someone sells to the Apaches. Dave, the son of a wealthy landowner, is involved, and when the young man is killed his father puts the blame on Lockhart and tries to avenge him. But the black soul of the whole operation is Vic, Dave's lieutenant, who also tries to kill the old man, saved instead by Lockhart. A classic of the genre, almost a classic tragedy, directed by a director who is one of the greatest storytellers of the western epic and with performers who work at their best. From a novel by Louis L'Amour.

title: Fugitive Rage
actors: Wendy Schumacher, Jay Richardson, Shauna O'Brien, Tim Abell
description: Former policewoman Tara McCormick is arrested for the attempted murder of drug kingpin Tommy Stompanato. In prison, the woman befriends an inmate named Josie Williams; shortly thereafter, a government agent offers her a second chance to take out Tommy in exchange for her freedom. Tara accepts, and the hunt begins ...

title: Demon Seed
actors: Julie Christie, Fritz Weaver, Gerrit Graham, Berry Kroeger, Lisa Lu, Larry J. Blake, John O'Leary, Alfred Dennis, Davis Roberts, Patricia Wilson
description: After years of work in a secret laboratory, some scientists have developed Proteus IV, a very sophisticated computer, capable of self-programming and which highlights human behavior. Proteus soon shows that he is tormented by the idea of ??procreation and Susan, the wife of the computer programmer, pays the price. Not without difficulty Proteus is deactivated, but in the meantime Susan is expecting a baby.
notes: On a subject fascinated by the myth of Beauty and the Beast, based on a novel by Dean R. Koontz, Cammell constructs a film that oscillates between pure thriller and science fiction. Charming and mysterious Julie Christie.

title: Captain from Castile
actors: Tyrone Power, Jean Peters, Lee J. Cobb, Cesar Romero, John Sutton
description: In 1518 Pedro Vargas, a Spanish gentleman, saves a runaway slave, escapes the Inquisition, which however kills his sister, and injures Don Diego De Silva, owner of the slave, in a duel. Then follows Fernando Cortez to America. Here Don Diego reappears, who is murdered. Pedro is immediately suspected of the murder and risks hanging but, acquitted, he will follow Cortez until victory.
notes: The historical background acts as a simple support for a show in which adventure predominates. Enjoyable.

title: Icebreaker
actors: Sean Astin, Bruce Campbell, Stacy Keach, Suzanne Turner
description: A serious threat looms over Killington ski resort, one of the most renowned in the United States. The evil Greig, leader of a group of terrorists, takes some tourists hostage and hides them in a secret place. To keep them company, a not very nice nuclear warhead stolen from an army arsenal. On the trail of the terrorists, a mountain rescue officer, Matt Foster. Who engages in a fight against time also to free his girlfriend, locked up with the other hostages.
notes: A high-adrenalin-fueled TV movie that has its strong point in the mountain setting.

title: The Hunting Party
actors: Gene Hackman, Oliver Reed, Candice Bergen, Simon Oakland
description: Frank, leader of a gang of outlaws, would like to learn to read and write and for this reason he kidnaps Melissa, a young teacher wife of Brandt, rich and degenerate ranchero. He, reached by the news of the kidnapping while some friends are traveling on a hunting trip during which long-range rifles and telescopes are tested, begins the search for the kidnappers. Meanwhile, Melissa, several times protected by Frank from the assaults of the other members of the gang, falls in love with him. The two attempt to save themselves by reaching the border and trying to escape Brandt's hunt.
notes: Violent and rather crude Western.

title: Super
actors: Rainn Wilson, Ellen Page, Liv Tyler, Kevin Bacon, Gregg Henry, Michael Rooker, Andre Royo, Sean Gunn, Stephen Blackehart, Linda Cardellini, Nathan Fillion
description: Frank is like many others, clumsy and mistreated by life. But when his wife leaves him to hook up with a drug dealer, Frank decides to become a superhero, at war with the bad guys. At his side a special ally: the saleswoman of a comic shop.
notes: Gunn knows how to stage a madness with an artisan flavor, far from the cartoon and digital security of the Hollywood patina and crossed by flashes of hyperviolence. The grotesque splatter fun, however, is only one layer, under which lies a sore melon, which in the end will risk breaking your heart.

title: The Old Dark House
actors: Tom Poston, Robert Morley, Janette Scott, Joyce Grenfell
description: Tom, a traveling salesman who trades in American cars, arrives one evening at Femm Castle in Wales to deliver one. Tom finds his client Caspar dead in a trap door in the manor, but that's not the only, shall we say, strange thing he discovers. The surprise is great when he gets to know the other members of the family, including the sisters of the deceased Morgana and Cecily. But the troubles for him are not over because other cruel crimes are committed in the old castle.
notes: Remake of the film of the same name directed by James Whale in 1932. Back then the actors were called Boris Karloff, Melvyn Douglas and Charles Laughton. Production is Columbia, Hammer and Castle.

title: Cell
actors: Samuel L. Jackson, John Cusack, Isabelle Fuhrman, Owen Teague, Stacy Keach, Wilbur Fitzgerald, Catherine Dyer, Joshua Mikel, Michael Beasley, Anthony Reynolds, Alex ter Avest, Rey Hernandez
description: A strange signal is propagating through mobile phone networks around the world. Thus begins a lethal epidemic of epic proportions that turns users into bloodthirsty creatures. Among the few survivors there is a group of people from New England, called to deal with the chaos generated.

title: Rage and Honor
actors: Cynthia Rothrock, Richard Norton, Terri Treas, Brian Thompson
description: Kris Fairchild (Rothroch) is a high school teacher, but her real specialty is hand-to-hand combat. Preston Michaels (Norton) is a taciturn police officer who came undercover from Australia. The two embark on a mission together and, using kicks, punches and various forbidden blows, they manage to defeat a drug kingpin and with him also the corrupt cops. The film is not much more than a series of fights, one after the other, almost at random. To be recommended only to martial arts fanatics and especially those of Rothrock who, of her genre, is a little star.

title: Virus
actors: Jamie Lee Curtis, William Baldwin, Donald Sutherland
description: Taken by surprise by a terrible typhoon in the South Pacific, the tugboat Sea Star loses its steel cargo and risks sinking. The seven men of the crew manage to lead the now out of use boat to a relatively quiet place. Suddenly they notice a huge Russian research ship, adrift and apparently abandoned. But a terrible alien force is hiding in the Russian ship ...
notes: An inexhaustible déjà vu experience for science fiction lovers. Taken from a mediocre comic book by Chuck Pfarrer and directed by the newcomer Bruno, a special effects technician, the film involves great actors in a shipwreck, but also annoys for the dated portrait reserved for the Russians, treacherous and warmongers as in McCarthyism.

title: Alien Nation
actors: James Caan, Mandy Patinkin, Terence Stamp, Kevin Major, Brian Thompson, Peter Jason, Leslie Bevis, Conrad Dunn, Jeff Kober, Brian Thompson
description: A large number of aliens capable of adapting to human life have been transported from another planet to Earth in a large spaceship. Equipped with special qualities, they do not struggle to fit into the daily life of humans even if some are viewed with much contempt by earthlings. One night, during a robbery, police sergeant Matthew Sykes sees his closest friend killed by aliens. To find out the perpetrators of the murder and, above all, the motive, he begins the investigation, naturally with the help of another alien.
notes: Unusual film capable of mixing thriller and science fiction, with clear intentions of allegory of the melting pot. Two TV series of the same title have been made from it.

title: Operator
actors: Ving Rhames, Luke Goss, Mischa Barton, Michael Paré, Riley Bundick, Tony Demil, Maurice Chevalier (II), Walter Hendrix III, Wendell Kinney, Summer Perkins
description: The daughter of a 911 operator and a policeman - an estranged husband - is kidnapped. They will be forced to send police and fire brigade units to remote locations under the orders of the kidnappers.

title: Moondance Alexander
actors: Kay Panabaker, Don Johnson, Lori Loughlin, James Best, Sasha Cohen, Whitney Sloan, Joe Norman Shaw, Mimi Gianopulos, Aedan Tomney, Landon Liboiron
description: Moondance Alexander is a lively little provincial girl who lives with an eccentric mother. At the beginning of yet another boring summer, one day he meets Checkers, a pony who has escaped from a farm. Once the pony is returned, Moondance is convinced that she has great qualities as a jumper and asks the owner (Don Johnson) to hire her as a groom and teach her to jump obstacles in order to participate in a great competition held in the county during the summer: an adventure that will lead her to win numerous races and to defeat the skepticism of her companions.

title: Alien Resurrection
actors: Sigourney Weaver, Winona Ryder, Dominique Pinon, Brad Dourif
description: Two hundred years have passed and a difficult cloning experiment is being successfully completed on the spaceship Auriga. Clone 8, or the new Ripley, is not only alive and kicking, but in the operation she had an abortion that separated her from the alien fetus she carried inside. But there's something weird Ripley doesn't remember anything from her past and she's gotten worse and there's a scientist conducting weird experiments.
notes: Jeunet, although openly disinterested in the action part of the film (which is in fact the weakest), found himself at home in the technological-crumbling tunnels of the Auriga space base, among the unsuccessful clones, the laboratory monsters, in the alien nursery "implanted" in humans. The film is marked by its very black sense of the grotesque and, of course, by the dominant presence of Sigourney Weaver, a heroine returned from the realm of the dead, now "changed", withered and gloomy, capable of an almost carnal relationship with the alien (who, after all, it is flesh of his flesh). Her obstinacy to protect humanity (she who is no longer human) almost consigns her to tragedy.

title: The Nesting
actors: John Carradine, Gloria Grahame, Robin Groves
description: A writer of gothic novels is drawn to a large, apparently uninhabited Victorian-era house. Obviously the house is far from uninhabited. Inside you will find the most imaginative and evil creatures protagonists of his stories.
notes: In the 1980s when splatters and severed heads were the order of the day in horror film scripts, few examples of good cinema were seen (Sam Raimi's "The House" (1983) is one of the few examples). This "La casa de sorcery" is certainly no better than the others.

title: Martin
actors: John Amplas, Lincoln Maazel, Tom Savini, Forrest Romero
description: Martin is a young man of 18 who claims to have lived through 84 years. His cousin Tata Cuda believes he is a deeply evil vampire. When Martin moves in with him in a small town in Pennsylvania, his cousin decides that if he has evidence of even one vampirism incident he will destroy the young man. But Martin's urges are difficult to control and when he falls in love with a housewife will he manage not to bite her on the neck?
notes: Romero starts from a horror plot but, while not lacking some gore sequences, he actually realizes a refined work on the characters and a critical reflection within the same genre.

title: Posse
actors: Kirk Douglas, Bruce Dern, Bo Hopkins, James Stacy, Luke Askew, David Canary, Alfonso Arau, Katherine Woodville, Mark Roberts, Beth Brickell
description: A politician (Douglas) hires adventurers to catch an outlaw (Dern). But it turns out he is almost a popular idol. Little violence and a lot of psychological tension: a surprising neo-western directed and starring Kirk Douglas.

title: Jumping Ship
actors: Joey Lawrence, Andrew Lawrence, Matthew Lawrence, Susan Walters
description: Michael and his cousin Tommy charter a luxury yacht on which they hope to have an unforgettable vacation. But their dreams of grandeur are shattered when they discover that the boat is a tub. And that's not all. Attacked by modern-day pirates, the two are forced to land on a desert island.

title: Last Action Hero
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Austin O'Brien, Charles Dance, F. Murray Abraham
description: Thanks to a magic ticket, little Benedict can enter the world of the film of his favorite hero, Slater (Schwarzenegger). When Benedict and Slater are in trouble, the ticket is used for the reverse journey: from fiction to reality. But here things are not going so well for the man who, in the cinema, was a real superman, and Slater decides to go back to the dimension of the illusory.
notes: The Americans didn't like it because it was "too complicated"! Instead, it is witty, very lively, self-deprecating, full of quotes for the pleasure of cinephiles. If anything, it's not a brand new idea, but even Schwarzy tries hard not to be trivial.

title: The Hangman
actors: Robert Taylor, Tina Louise, Fess Parker, Jack Lord, Gene Evans, Mickey Shaughnessy, Shirley Harmer, James Westerfield
description: Young Butterfield is accused of complicity in the bloody assault on a stagecoach. The inflexible Sheriff Bovard, who has never seen him, looks for him helped by Sheila, a widow who has known him. Butterfield is married under a false name in North Creeck, where he works esteemed by the townspeople and the sheriff. Everyone knows his story and they know he is innocent. And even tough Bovard will understand this. Flawless little western by the old Curtiz, here almost at the end of his career (like the protagonist Taylor).

title: Three Hours to Kill
actors: Dana Andrews, Donna Reed
description: A stagecoach driver accused of a crime has three hours to prove his innocence. An hour and a quarter of tight, thrilling action: the best of Serie B.

title: Vice
actors: Bruce Willis, Ambyr Childers, Thomas Jane, Bryan Greenberg, Charlotte Kirk, Brett Granstaff, Ryan O'Nan, Tyler J. Olson, Douglas M. Griffin, Martin Blencowe, Damon Lipari, Ashley Kirk
description: Julian Michaels designed the resort of the resorts: Vice, a place where everything is allowed and customers can let loose their wildest fantasies with the artificial inhabitants of the place, similar to human beings. When she becomes aware of herself and runs away from Vice, an android will find herself at the center of attention of the mercenaries hired by Julian to find her and a policeman, intent on ending the violence of the resort forever.

title: 6 Bullets
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Joe Flanigan, Bianca Bree, Kristopher Van Varenberg, Anna-Louise Plowman, Louis Dempsey, Terese Cilluffo, Jimmy Townsend, Uriel Emil Pollack, Charlotte Beaumont
description: Former mercenary Samson Gaul (Van Damme) has decided to retire from the business following strong pangs of conscience. However, he decides to accept a new assignment when a mixed martial arts champion hires him with the aim of finding his young daughter who has been kidnapped.

title: After the Sunset
actors: Pierce Brosnan, Salma Hayek, Woody Harrelson, Don Cheadle, Naomie Harris, Chris Penn
description: Max Burdett and Lola Cirillo, professional thieves, after a last millionaire heist take refuge in the Bahamas to enjoy the fruits of their thefts. But federal agent Stan Lloyd, who has been chasing them for eight years, discovers that the two are plotting a new and astonishing blow: the stakes, this time, will be a very precious diamond ...
notes: In the delicate balance between action and comedy, the first works decidedly better than the second: which, compressed between the cries of Hayek and a slightly uncomfortable Harrelson in comic clothes, is weak and tears a few laughter without conviction. Brosnan's performance is also mediocre.

title: Surrogates
actors: Bruce Willis, Radha Mitchell, Rosamund Pike, Ving Rhames, Michael Cudlitz, Helena Mattsson, Boris Kodjoe, Jack Noseworthy, Valerie Azlynn, Devin Ratray
description: In the near future, the world is inhabited by human beings who live in total digital isolation, a sort of cyberspace where you can interact with the outside world through surrogates, or through personal androids, real humanoid alter egos. A policeman, also thanks to his robotic clone, is on the trail of a tech terrorist who dreams of a world where men can live without surrogates.
notes: This film may be small, but it has all the stigmata of the great and beloved disciple of Don Siegel's Invasion of the Body Snatchers: ideologies waned, communism destroyed, now we are our own enemies.

title: Leprechaun
actors: Warwick Davis, Jennifer Aniston, Ken Olandt, Mark Holton
description: In Ireland, Dan O'Grady finds the gold of the "leprechaun", a sort of evil wood elf. Back home, the man locks the creature in the cellar and tries to burn it, but he dies of a heart attack; ten years later, J.D. and his daughter Tory buy Dan's house, unaware of what is hiding there ...
notes: First episode of an endless horror-gothic series.

title: The Car
actors: James Brolin, Kathleen Lloyd, Ronny Cox
description: In the quiet Californian countryside, a black out-of-production model is spotted one day, apparently without a driver and of an unknown brand. The car whizzes through the streets of the cities and kills anyone who comes within range. Someone tries to stop her, but the mechanical monster turns out to be animated by a demonic entity.
notes: A theme that already fascinated the writer Richard Matheson (and that Stephen King will passionate about), that of the murderous mechanical means. Not surprisingly, Silverstein's film mentions "Duel", which was based precisely on a story by Matheson. Professional packaging but suspense to look for with the lantern.

title: Raw Deal
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Kathryn Harrold, Darren McCavin, Sam Wanamaker, Paul Shenar, Robert Davi, Ed Lauter, Joe Regalbuto, Steven Hill
description: Banned from the FBI for his hasty methods, Mark Kaminski (Schwarzenegger) scrambles to find the killers of Harry Shannon's son, a no longer young ex-colleague. After faking his own death, he infiltrates the ranks of the powerful Petrovita mafia family, causing such a disruption that he is rehabilitated as a federal agent.
notes: Fracassona and approximate story, which fails to please despite some successful touch of humor. Schwarzenegger, at the height of his career after films like "Conan the Barbarian" and "Terminator", could already afford to make a living on his character.

title: The Vault
actors: James Franco, Taryn Manning, Francesca Eastwood, Scott Haze, Q'Orianka Kilcher, Jeff Gum, Clifton Collins jr., Keith Loneker, Jill Jane Clements, Michael Milford
description: In an attempt to save their brother Michael's life, the two Dillon sisters - Leah and Vee - organize a bank robbery. Since they do not raise enough money in the upper deposit, on the advice of the bank manager Ed Maas, they rush to the lower level. Here, however, they make a terrible discovery. The two sisters will be forced to choose between facing the police outside or fighting the terrible supernatural forces that populate the basement of the bank.

title: Eruption: LA
actors: Matthew Atkinson, Lexi Johnson, Eric Etebari, Amy Paffrath, Harry Van Gorkum, Tom Schanley, Victoria Gabrielle Platt, Matthew Willig, Kelcey Watson, Christina Wren
description: Josh Kendricks, a struggling screenwriter, finds himself at the center of a catastrophe due to volcanic eruptions that threaten to blow up all of Los Angeles. Together with Quinn Irwin, a scientist turned writer, and Hollywood star Kat Rivers, Josh will have to do everything to ensure that the city is not wiped out for good.

title: Lionheart
actors: Eric Stoltz, Gabriel Byrne, Nicola Cowper, Dexter Fletcher
description: Richard the Lionheart has already left for the Crusades and is on the way to the Holy Sepulcher. A very young knight (Stoltz) tries to intercept him in France to be able to join him. Instead, it happens that flocks of disadvantaged and homeless kids (and moreover on the run from the evil Black Prince) join him. What was initially a solitary initiative thus becomes a small army. You wouldn't expect such an enjoyable and original film. Yet here everything works: from the subject to the choice of actors.

title: Devil's Doorway
actors: Robert Taylor, Louis Calhern, Paula Raymond, Marshall Thompson
description: An Indian fights bravely with the North in the American Civil War, but upon returning to Wyoming he finds himself hated and discriminated against by his former comrades. Excellent pro-Indian western, even more beautiful than the contemporary Indian Lover, marks the debut in the genre of Mann, who will be one of the greatest masters.

title: Treasure Island
actors: Wallace Beery, Jackie Cooper, Lewis Stone, Lionel Barrymore
description: Dying Captain Bones gives Jim Hawkins a map with directions to where Captain Flint's treasure is buried. Little Jim leaves with the Hispaniola to reach the remote island, but as soon as he disembarks he has to deal with a group of pirates commanded by Long John Silver.
notes: One of the best transpositions of Robert Louis Stevenson's novel. Great interpretation by Wallace Beery. There is a colorized version.

title: The Plainsman
actors: Don Murray, Guy Stockwell, Abby Dalton, Leslie Nielsen
description: Wild Bill Hickok is attacked by the Red Indians and is saved only thanks to the intervention of his old friend Black Bison. During the attack he realizes that the Indians have firearms recently supplied to the Unionist army.
notes: Weak remake of Cecil B. DeMille's "Conquest of the West".

title: Vigilante
actors: Robert Forster, Fred Williamson, Richard Bright
description: His family is attacked by a group of deviant punk killers and rapists. He (Robert Forster), from the quiet man he was, turns into a bloodthirsty avenger. The story recalls "The executioner of the night"; Lustig will then do "Mania Cop" but here he does not get out of the routine.

title: Enchanted
actors: Amy Adams, Patrick Dempsey, James Marsden, Susan Sarandon, Timothy Spall, Idina Menzel, Rachel Covey
description: Giselle is a princess who is expelled from the magical world of Cartoonia by an evil queen and thus ends up projected in today's New York: here she will be forced to confront a completely different reality and will change many of her points of view, including - above all - the one about love ...
notes: Disney brand "Panettone", with more irony and inventiveness than usual: amused in quoting and mocking the fairytale imagery of the parent company, which, however, does not come out demolished but rather reinforced by a clever modernization. However, a honeyed underlying moralism remains, but the balance between writing for children and cinephilia for adults is well calibrated.The film has achieved a huge success with audiences, earning around 340 million dollars worldwide, against an estimated budget. around 85 million and earned three Oscar nominations for three songs, all with music by Alan Menken and lyrics by Stephen Schwartz.

title: Predator 2
actors: Danny Glover, Gary Busey, Rubén Blades, Maria Conchita Alonso, Bill Paxton
description: Los Angeles, 1997. In the city it is everyone's war against everyone; one group, in particular, leaves behind quartered corpses, marked with voodoo symbols. The affair is dealt with by Mike Harrigan, a black policeman, who discovers and confronts a group of aliens barricaded in a slaughterhouse.
notes: Between science fiction and horror, an action film that tries to build somewhat improbable gothic atmospheres. Bungled and smashed, with some spectacular moments. Schwarzy, protagonist of the first "Predator" is not here; the hero of the moment is Danny Glover.

title: The Signal
directors: David Bruckner, Jacob Gentry, Dan Bush
actors: Anessa Ramsey, Sahr Ngaujah, AJ Bowen, Matthew Stanton, Suehyla El-Attar, Justin Welborn, Cheri Christian, Scott Poythress, Christopher Thomas, Lindsey Garrett, Chad McKnight
description: In Terminus, where Ben and his mistress Mya live, a radio signal takes over all electrical devices, driving anyone who comes into contact with them crazy. It's chaos: As the trail of violence and death lengthens, Ben, miraculously escaping the radiation, sets out on a desperate search for Mya.

title: Billy Two Hats
actors: Gregory Peck, Desi Arnaz jr., Jack Warden, Sian Barbara Allen, David Huddleston, John Pearce, Dawn Little Sky, Vincent St. Cyr, Henry Medicine Hat
description: Henry is a bandit who is paired with Billy, a young half-caste. When Billy, captured by Sheriff Arch, is about to be hanged, Henry promptly arrives to rescue him.
