At that point, the only hope for the two is to arrive in Mexico. Henry is injured; a certain Spencer offers himself as a guide, but, in addition to the sheriff, the Indians also get involved.
notes: Western with a beautiful setting (Kotcheff was also the director of the first "Rambo", remarkable in this respect). Written by Alan Sharp, also screenwriter of "Night Target" (Penn) and "No Mercy for Ulzana" (Aldrich).

title: Born in Flames
actors: Honey, Adele Bertei, Jean Satterfield, Florynce Kennedy, Becky Johnston, Pat Murphy, Kathryn Bigelow, Hillary Hurst, Sheila McLaughlin, Marty Pottenger, Lynne Jones, Ron Vawter, John Coplans, John Rudolph, Warner Schreiner, Valerie Smaldone, John McLearen, Pat Place, Julia Hanlon, Maria David, Toviana Starks, Cat Hightower, Veronica Campbell, Mayumi Sakaguchi, Ryan, Chris Brewer, Bill Tatum, Jorge Ramos, Julio Peña, Merián Soto, Mark Boone Junior, Dana Johnson, Jerry Nixon, Gary Valdes, Dirk Zimmer, Jacques Sandulescu, Gary Hill, Sis McQuader, Susan Sawyer, Sherry Rosso, Donna Allegra Simms, Valerie Jones, Ramona Galindez, Katy Taylor, Marion Benjamin, Joan Ellis, Carolyn Fitzgerald, Alice Sullivan, Belle Chevigny, Paul Zonghetti, Alexa Evans, Malick N'Diaye, Dolly Udemzue, Barbara Scott, Hanita, Diane Jacobs, Felice Rosser, Hal Miller, Peggy Lee Brennan, Michael Sullivan, Nancy Reilly, Rosemary Hochschild, Vanessa Zannis, Sheila Carr, Ed Bowes, Allan Ryan, Kathy Gunst, Amy Chen, Patrick Brogan, Edmead Smith, Daniel Edelman, Mike Bencivenga, Walter Scheuer, Eric Bogosian, Paul Chevigny, Joel Kovel, Gregory Samuels, Bill Sturgis, Tom Whittaker
description: In New York, 10 years after the "Social Democratic Liberation War", various groups of women organize a feminist revolt to achieve the coveted equality.

title: Dawn at Socorro
actors: Rory Calhoun, Piper Laurie, David Brian, Alex Nicol, Kathleen Hughes, Edgar Buchanan, Mara Corday, Roy Roberts, Skip Homeier
description: A gunslinger, determined to end his past, is forced to endure a final, decisive duel.
notes: A good western by a modest specialist with second-rate actors.

title: Armageddon
actors: Bruce Willis, Liv Tyler, Ben Affleck, Billy Bob Thornton, Will Patton
description: An asteroid the size of the state of Texas is heading towards Earth at the speed of 22,000 miles per hour. NASA director Dan Truman has no choice: he must set up and send a crew into space to try to thwart the threat. The mission is entrusted to Harry S. Stamper, who together with his men must land on the asteroid, pierce its surface and place a nuclear bomb.
notes: A bad film, not so much for its cinematic inconsistency and total lack of irony, but because it sums up the philosophy of the latest blockbusters: accumulation of action scenes and that's it. Result: boredom.

title: To Catch a King
actors: Robert Wagner, Teri Garr, Horst Janson, John Standing, Barbara Parkins, Marcel Bozzuffi, Barry Foster, Jane Lapotaire, Edmund Kente
description: We are in 1942, in Lisbon. Joe Jackson is an American night club owner, Hannah Winter is a singer who ends up in the midst of a Nazi conspiracy. The Germans plan to kidnap the Duke and Duchess of Windsor, who were residing in Portugal at the time. Joe and Hannah try together to prevent the sensational kidnapping, but a shrewd German general notices it and catches them in a nutshell ... The reference is Casablanca, even if the story then takes other paths. The cast is of a certain authority, Robert Wagner is all dressed in white and Clive Donner at the time also did Ciao Pussycat.

title: Sundown
actors: David Carradine, Maxwell Caulfield, John Ireland
description: A typical American family, optimistic enough, decides to move from the East coast to the heart of the Big Country, in that West that is still partly wild. The destination chosen for the new stay, however, is a strange village surrounded by the desert that certainly does not make a good impression. The place is in fact populated by a community of vampires who try in every way to vampirize the newcomers.
notes: The story begins by aligning some original ideas that promise well, but gradually flattens out on the easier stereotypes.

title: Lies & Illusions
actors: Christian Slater, Cuba Gooding jr., Sarah Ann Schultz, Christa Campbell, Robert Giardina, Al Madrigal, Kelly Hyde, Lochlyn Munro, Dominic Salvatore, Tracy Schornick
description: Wes Wilson is a writer who became famous thanks to a bestseller, in which he explains how honesty is the only weapon to save romantic relationships. When his girlfriend is kidnapped and left for dead, his life suddenly takes an unexpected turn: chased by a secret agent, the man suddenly finds himself trapped in a shady game of spy intrigue and stolen diamonds. He will discover that his girlfriend is not quite the person he thought he knew ...
notes: Action comedy with the interesting duo Christian Slater-Cuba Gooding jr. Behind the camera directs the Hungarian-born director who shot the horror fantasy _Do not open that gate_ in the 1980s.

title: Fast & Furious 6
actors: Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Dwayne Johnson, Jordana Brewster, Michelle Rodriguez, Luke Evans, Gina Carano, Gal Gadot, Tyrese Gibson, Sung Kang, Ludacris, Elsa Pataky
description: After overthrowing the empire of a boss in Rio, Dom Toretto (Vin Diesel) and Brian O'Conner (Paul Walker) have dedicated themselves to traveling the world, unable as they are to go home and take back everything they left behind. behind. Meanwhile, Hobbs (Dwayne Johnson) has instead stumbled upon the case of an organization of criminal pilots, whose boss (Luke Ewans) is assisted by a woman who turns out to be Letty (Michelle Rodriguez), the ex of Dom who all they thought she was dead. In an attempt to permanently knock them out, Hobbs asks Dom to put London's elite squad back together.
notes: More and more exasperated, the saga loved by the box office and designed for tuning fanatics and lovers of cursed James Dean is enchanted by the action pedal that has marred us since the 90s, the one that mixes irony and good reconciling feelings on cartoon evolutions of the bodies and the virtuosity of choreographies always happy to cross the threshold of credibility, so as to elicit laughter and applause from the amused satisfaction of the public. Watch out for the finale, which winks at Marvel ways and launches the inevitable sequel.

title: Virtuosity
actors: Denzel Washington, Russell Crowe, Kelly Lynch, Stephen Spinella
description: We are in the future and Sid 6.7 is a unit made up of two hundred different personalities of dangerous criminals, mixed together, used to train police officers. However Sid, tired of bits and bytes, decides to leave cyberspace to devote himself to the murder of men in flesh and blood. The only one who seems to be able to face and defeat him is Parker Barnes, a former cop who ended up in jail for executing the killer of his wife and daughter.
notes: Usual clash between Good and Evil against the backdrop of a late millennium Los Angeles (we are in fact in 1999). The director is Brett Leonard who had directed "Il taglaierbe" with Pierce Brosnan.

title: Honky Tonk Freeway
actors: Beau Bridges, Hume Cronyn, Beverly D'Angelo, William Devane, Geraldine Page, Jessica Tandy

title: The Cat in the Hat
actors: Mike Myers, Dakota Fanning, Spencer Breslin, Alec Baldwin, Kelly Preston
description: Sally and Conrad, left alone at home with their goldfish, are bored: it's raining outside and they don't know how to pass the time. Suddenly a strange character knocks on the door: a talking cat who drags them on a series of fun adventures.
notes: The baby actors are magnificent and the adults, apart from Myers who unleashed his taste for grotesque characters, experience these contractual commitments as a vacation from methods, schools and techniques. Alec Baldwin, crude, vain, self-righteous, is hilarious. The film thrives on gimmicks and disconnected scenes, but it is better than many fragile scripts without rhyme or reason. Goldfish deserves a place in the fantasy of contemporary cinema.

title: Beau Geste
actors: Guy Stockwell, Doug McClure, Leslie Nielsen, Telly Savalas
description: The American Beau allows him to be blamed for a crime he has not committed and, to escape conviction, he enlisted in the Foreign Legion. Beau, nicknamed Geste, just arrived at Fort Zinderneuf, is suspected of having sent a threatening letter to Sergeant Dagineau, the tyrannical instructor of the department to which he was assigned. The sergeant mistreats the American, who gains understanding of the fort's inept commander. Beau Geste, joined by his brother John, will find himself in a position to save Dagineau's life during an assault by the Tuareg.
notes: Third passable version of Percival's Christopher Wren novel.

title: Kill'em All
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Autumn Reeser, Peter Stormare, Maria Conchita Alonso, Daniel Bernhardt, Kris Van Damme, Mila Kaladjurdjevic, Paul Sampson, Kieran Gallagher, Peter Organ
description: After a bloody shooting, a mysterious man is taken to the hospital dying. Shortly thereafter, a gang of criminals also arrives to kill him. Only a hospital nurse, the only witness who survived the shooting, will be able to help him.

title: Anne of The Indies
actors: Jean Peters, Debra Paget, Louis Jourdan, Herbert Marshall
description: Anna, to avenge her brother's death, embarks on a pirate ship. Nicknamed Captain Providence, she falls in love with a French pirate paid by the British to hand her over to the authorities.
notes: Duels and battles, love triumphs in the end: classic adventure film made with craftsmanship.

title: Militia
actors: Dean Cain, Jennifer Beals, Frederic Forrest, Stacy Keach, John Beck
description: Special Agent Ethan Carter must infiltrate the subversive "Brotherhood of Liberty" militia, a far-right paramilitary organization that wants to overthrow the US government and impose a new world order. The dangerous group, led by TV presenter George Armstrong, has come into possession of three missiles with enormous destructive potential and threaten the life of the American President. Alongside Carter, in addition to the charming recruit Julia Sanders, is former Special Agent Fain, a shadow of the protagonist's past ...

title: Rolling Thunder
actors: William Devane, Tommy Lee Jones, Linda Haynes, James Best, Dabney Coleman, Lisa Blake Richards, Luke Askew, Lawrason Driscoll, James Victor, Cassie Yates
description: Major Charlie Rane has just returned from seven years of war in Vietnam and the local community, considering him a hero, pays homage to him with a large sum of money. Interested in getting their hands on the money, some thieves break into the man's house, seriously injuring him and killing his wife and child. Rane, after a period of convalescence in the hospital, decides to take up arms again to search for the criminals and carry out his personal revenge. Two friends will help him in his quest: Linda, an old flame, and Johnny Vohden (Tommy Lee Jones), his ex-comrade.

title: The Last Push
actors: Khary Payton, Lance Henriksen, Brian Baumgartner, James Madio, Alec Gillis, Tom Woodruff Jr., Laurent Meurette, Pascal Lamontagne, Druid Altura, Irwin Altura
description: A tragic accident derails plans for a first human exploration mission to Europa, a moon of Jupiter. One of the two astronauts in flight is dead and Michael Forrest is thus forced to face the long journey back from space to home in complete solitude and fear.

title: Man in the Shadow?
actors: Jeff Chandler, Orson Welles, Colleen Miller, Barbara Lawrence
description: Sheriff Ben Sadler is on the trail of the culprit in the merciless murder of a Mexican farmhand. The mighty Virgil Renchler, owner of the 'Golden Empire', one of the largest properties in the county, attempts to convince the sheriff to downsize and cover up the case. The sheriff, however, is determined to follow the course of justice even if all the clues seem to lead to Virgil. But what could have been the motive?

title: Monolith
actors: Bill Paxton, Lindsay Frost, John Hurt, Louis Gossett jr.
description: Tucker and Flinn, two Los Angeles police officers, accidentally discover that Villano, head of a seemingly harmless Department of Historical Research, has spotted a shapeless alien force and secretly attempts to exploit it. The operation, however, gets out of hand to the sorcerer's apprentice. Successful product in terms of story and visual effects, but poorly served by the dialogues. The star couple, played by Bill Paxton ("Tombstone") and his energetic partner Lindsay Frost, are close-knit.

title: Saw III
actors: Tobin Bell, Shawnee Smith, Angus MacFadyen, Bahar Soomekh, Donnie Wahlberg
description: Dr. Lynn is kidnapped and locked in a room by Jigsaw, the "Riddler", and faithful Amanda. The tumor ravaging Jigsaw progresses, and Lynn is tasked with keeping the Riddler alive until her new victim, Jeff, has finished one of her games ...
notes: There is little to do, the still short _Saw_ series is among the most original and (for fans) exciting genre "brands" of recent times. The only ones who have been able to "work" on; the only ones who have continually reinvented themselves, to say and look at something else (ve). Faint of heart and easily impressionable refrain: sadism is at times unbearable.

title: Song of the South
actors: James Baskett, Bobby Driscoll, Luana Patten, Hattie McDaniel
description: Little Johnny meets Uncle Tom, an old black man who knows the art of storytelling. The two become friends and, to every difficulty that Johnny encounters in life, Uncle Tom responds with a story that exemplifies his moral. Produced by Walt Disney, the film is interspersed with animation clips (directed by Wilfred Jacjson) with Brother Bunny, Compare Bear and Comare Volpe, which remain the best. Oscar for best song.

title: Out for a Kill
actors: Steven Seagal, Michelle Goh, Corey Johnson, Kata Dobó, Kevin Dunn
description: Archaeologist Robert Burns is sent to China to direct major excavations. Here he finds himself involved, in spite of himself, in a grandiose drug trade. The Chinese mafia in fact uses the finds to hide huge quantities of drugs and thus cross the border without arousing suspicion. Burns tries to report the trafficking, but his assistant is killed and he is charged with the murder. When Robert kills his wife, the situation becomes terribly complicated.
notes: Time also passes for Steven Seagal who in the action scenes has been replaced by a double. For the rest, nothing new under the sun.

title: Valley of the Kings
actors: Robert Taylor, Eleanor Parker, Kurt Kasznar, Carlos Thompson, Victor Jory
description: After the death of her father, the daughter of a well-known archaeologist continues her search for evidence of the historical truth of the biblical story in the Valley of the Kings. She has to contend with sandstorms, desert raiders, and even her greedy husband. Exotic adventurous unpretentious, but lively enough.

title: The Lost Boys
actors: Jason Patric, Corey Haim, Dianne Wiest, Jami Gertz, Barnard Hughes, Edward Herrmann, Kiefer Sutherland, Corey Feldman, Jamison Newlander, Brooke McCarter, Billy Wirth, Alex Winter
description: Young Michael gets into trouble with a punk gang. But everyone understands, even his younger brother Sam, that they are vampires instead. The cast is very interesting, the direction a little less, but it's still a compelling juvenile horror.

title: Relic
actors: Penelope Ann Miller, Tom Sizemore, Linda Hunt
description: In the meanders of the Chicago Museum of Natural History, a frightening creature from Brazil wanders, the result of magical rituals and genetic experiments that feeds on human hypothalamus. The multiform monster manifests itself in all its voracity during a party given inside the Museum during a black out. But an enterprising scientist and a portly, superstitious, animal-rights policeman take matters into their own hands.
notes: It is halfway between "The X Files" and the catastrophic, but it has neither the enveloping atmosphere of the former, nor the devastating spectacle of the latter. On the other hand, it is cunning and simplistic enough not to irritate anyone. Penelope Ann Miller and Tom Sizemore are nice, normal, and hasty enough to keep up a story without mystery. Director Peter Hyams did better, and worse.

title: Annabelle: Creation
actors: Miranda Otto, Anthony LaPaglia, Stephanie Sigman, Talitha Bateman, Lulu Wilson, Grace Fulton, Philippa Coulthard, Tayler Buck, Lou Lou Safran, Samara Lee
description: Several years after the tragic death of their little daughter, a doll maker and his wife welcome a nun and several girls from an orphanage into their home. These will soon become the target of Annabelle, the diabolical man-made doll.

title: Tremors
actors: Kevin Bacon, Fred Ward, Finn Carter, Michael Gross, Reba McEntire
description: In Perfection, the ironic name of a microscopic and far from perfect inhabited center between the desert and the mountains of Nevada, some very rapid and voracious underground snakes make their terrible appearance. Blind, but sensitive to the slightest noise, the worms strike with no escape, destroying and swallowing anything. The small community is forced into an all-out battle.
notes: A beautiful horror shot all in the light of the sun with some comic vein and many references to old films of the fifties. Good cast with Kevin Bacon in the lead. Excellent special effects made by the same technicians of "Terminator".

title: Moon of the Wolf
actors: David Janssen, Barbara Rush, Bradford Dillman
description: Aaron Whitaker (David Janssen), a marshland sheriff in Louisiana, investigates a series of savage assassins. The policeman begins the search believing he is dealing with a ruthless serial killer, but soon unequivocal clues convince him that he is on the trail of a werewolf. Could it be true, or is it a ruse to mislead the investigation? This TV product lacks action and suspense. The subject is based on a novel by Leslie Whitten.

title: The Corpse Vanishes
actors: Bela Lugosi, Luana Walters, Tristram Coffin, Elizabeth Russell, Minerva Urecal, Angelo Rossitto, Joan Barclay, Kenneth Harlan, Gwen Kenyon, Vince Barnett
description: On her wedding day, Alice receives a poisoned orchid as a gift, whose perfume makes her fall into suspended animation. The flower was sent by the diabolical Dr. Lorenz, who kidnaps young brides at the altar and uses their bodies to draw an experimental fluid, a powerful filter of beauty for his vain consort. Journalist Patricia discovers that the disappearances are related to the rare orchid, and the flower is only grown by Dr. Lorenz. But framing an evil genius will not be easy ...
notes: Absurd but linear weave of which it is impossible not to smile. The scene in which Lugosi whips his big, late assistant anticipates a similar sequence in Ed Wood's cinematography.

title: The Specialist
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Sharon Stone, James Woods, Rod Steiger
description: May Munro is obsessed with avenging her parents' deaths. Death caused, when she was a child, by the Leon clan, a family of Latin American criminals headed by Joe, instigator of the murder, and by his son Tomas. May manages to convince Ray Quick, a former CIA agent specializing in explosives, to brush up on her qualities to help her out. The two carry out revenge and end up loving each other. Only Ned Trent, former colleague of Ray and now on the side of the Leon, turns out to be a tough nut to crack. Bombs and sex with "Rambo" Stallone and the sensual Sharon Stone, but the film is very obvious.

title: Unforgiven
actors: Clint Eastwood, Gene Hackman, Morgan Freeman, Richard Harris
description: A group of prostitutes wants to take revenge on two cowboys who have scarred one of them. The Kid comes forward and convinces the former gunslinger rusty from age and grief for the loss of his beloved wife William Munny. Munny's trusted friend the black Ned Logan is also added. The latter is killed and Munny beaten to death. But the killer’s soul has the upper hand, and the former gunslinger clashes with the enemy of the past ...
notes: Eastwood has made a film in which the strong themes of the western genre are praised in the cold and desperation of tragedy. This is why the film resembles a "noir" where heroes can no longer exist. Oscar for Best Picture, Direction, Gene Hacman as Supporting and Editing.

title: Cat People
actors: Nastassja Kinski, Malcolm McDowell, John Heard, Annette O'Toole, Ruby Dee, Ed Begley jr., Scott Paulin, Frankie Faison, Lynn Lowry, John Larroquette
description: Irena Gallier (Kinski) is already grown up, but still a virgin, when she first meets her brother Paul (McDowell). Paul explains that a curse weighs on the two of them: every time they fall in love they turn into panthers. Paul tries anyway with Irena, gets rejected, looks for a prostitute, and of course, turns into a panther. Oliver Yates (Heard), the zoo manager, captures him and puts him in a cage. It is always Yates who offers Irena a job and falls in love with her, with all the risks involved.
notes: Schrader manages to win the bet of making a remake of the Tourneur classic, at least partially. Taking advantage of the horror theme of transformation, he highlights the sexual motive and inserts the incestuous variant into it. In the choice of actors he hits the mark with McDowell, as always tormented and perverse, and exploits the angelic aspect of Nastassja Kinski.

title: Mercenary
actors: Olivier Gruner, John Ritter, Robert Culp, Ed Lauter, Michael Zelniker
description: To settle the score with Vassili Borfchenko, an international terrorist who accidentally killed his wife in an attack, the wealthy businessman Jonas Ambler hires the mercenary Carl Hawk May, former captain of the special assault troops. The wanted man is a former Red Army officer who, after the collapse of the USSR, gathered the men of his squad of elite soldiers, transforming the latter into a combat unit in the service of the highest bidder. His lair is located in a Middle Eastern country: and it is that Ambler and May disembark here, determined to break into the Borfchenko base by any means ...

title: The Light Touch
actors: Stewart Granger, George Sanders, Anna Maria Pierangeli, Kurt Kasznar, Joseph Calleia, Larry Keating, Rhys Williams, Norman Lloyd, Mike Mazurki
description: A thief of works of art meets a young Italian painter and repents. The slow pace makes the film slide towards the sentimental vein and the tension of the story appears too centered on the dialogues.

title: Seminole
actors: Rock Hudson, Anthony Quinn, Barbara Hale, Lee Marvin
description: Lieutenant Caldwell arrives at Fort Klig: here he finds Revere, the childhood companion he is in love with, but not John, the friend of the time. John, the son of an Indian, has placed himself at the head of the Seminole tribe with the name of Osceola. Major Degan would like to exterminate the Indians and both Caldwell and Osceola will, to varying degrees, fall victim to his hatred of the Indians.
notes: Making one of the first westerns of his filmography, Boetticher stigmatizes militaristic drifts and starts his own personal journey within the American genre par excellence. The contribution of Russell Metty's "luxuriant" photography was decisive.

title: The Scarlet Coat
actors: Cornel Wilde, Michael Wilding, George Sanders, Anne Francis, Robert Douglas, John McIntire, Rhys Williams, John Dehner, James Westerfield, Ashley Cowan, Paul Cavanagh
description: The war of independence against the British is now in the decisive phase. The US military instructs an officer to find out who the general is who passed information to the enemy. The officer insinuates himself into the enemy ranks and here he meets the beautiful Sally, with whom an English officer is also in love. The American manages to find out who the traitor is, while Sally falls in love with him; for his part, the English officer accepts the shooting without batting an eye.
notes: The future director of the "Magnificent Seven" also proves skilled in this espionage story set two centuries ago. The color lives up to the Metro tradition.

title: Creep 2
actors: Mark Duplass, Karan Soni, Patrick Brice, Desiree Akhavan, Caveh Zahedi, Kyle Field, Jeff Man
description: Josef, apparently a good guy, is a lonely and psychopathic killer. But something in him is changing. But what really happens when a serial killer like him doesn't like killing anymore?
notes: Sequel to Creep (2014).

title: Shallow Ground
actors: Timothy V. Murphy, Stan Kirsch, Lindsey Stoddart, Patty McCormack, Rocky Marquette, Natalie Avital, Chris Hendrie, Tara Killian, Myron Natwick, Steve Eastin
description: A young man wanders completely naked in a wood, with a bloodstained knife in his hand; nearby, a police station is about to close its doors. After finding the boy, the sheriff sets off in search of another girl who is still lost in the bush and has been tied to a tree, a prisoner of a psychopath. Thus begins a long chain of murders and revenge ...
notes: An independent product, written without psychological complications and conceived as a supernatural slasher. The blood runs profusely but the script is more confusing than disturbing and gets lost along the way.

title: The Tingler
actors: Vincent Price, Judith Evelyn, Darryl Hickman, Patricia Cutts, Pamela Lincoln, Philip Coolidge
description: Dr. Chapin is a pathologist who regularly performs autopsies on executed inmates in the state prison and who has a strange theory about fear. In fact, he argues that fear is the effect of the presence of something inside us and that the screams of fear we emit are intended to annihilate that presence. When he meets Ollie and Martha Higgins, who run a second-rate cinema, he finally gets a chance to put his theory to the test. Martha is in fact deaf and dumb and therefore cannot scream: this, according to Chapin, should be able to make evident the presence of the being if she were faced with great fright. Thus administering LSD to Martha, she begins her experiments.

title: Warm Bodies
actors: Nicholas Hoult, Teresa Palmer, John Malkovich, Rob Corddry, Dave Franco, Analeigh Tipton, Cory Hardrict, Justin Bradley, Patrick Sabongui, Ayisha Issa
description: R (Nicholas Hoult) is a young zombie in the middle of an existential crisis who, unlike his lineage that is putting the entire United States on fire, dreams of being able to have a normal life. Without memories of the past and without any identity, after killing a human teenager and eating his brain, he meets his girlfriend Julie (Teresa Palmer), whose sweetness and vitality push him to experience emotions never known before and make a decision that will change. forever the fate of the entire planet.
notes: Jonathan Levine's film is a putrescent and enthusiastic Bildungsroman, ventilated by the freshness of the original pages (by Isaac Marion, first-time author) and rides the trend of urban gothic full of erotic and sentimental implications. Levine makes fun of himself without forgetting the essence of every revolution: the heartbeat of the individual can put the blood of a people back into circulation. Alive or (not) dead.

title: Riddick
actors: Vin Diesel, Karl Urban, Katee Sackhoff, Jordi Mollà, Nolan Gerard Funk, Matt Nable, Bokeem Woodbine, Dave Bautista, Conrad Pla, Raoul Trujillo, Nolan Funk, Keri Hilson
description: Left for dead by his enemies, Riddick (Vin Diesel) has been abandoned on a sunburnt planet populated by alien predators, far more dangerous than the humans he'd found himself fighting against. The only way to survive their attacks is to try to reach an emergency beacon and alert the ships of mercenaries who could bring it to safety. Unfortunately for Riddick, the first spaceship to arrive is that of the arrogant Captain Santana (Jordi Mollà), at the head of a group of hunters willing to brave even the greatest storm ever seen in order not to leave without his head.
notes: Riddick's new initiation is the real theoretical heart of a film capable of reflecting for a long time on the character's body. Body engraved with scars as remnants of memory. Body worn out by the struggle and often helpless. Body for the first time granted to sex, in the only moment of the saga in which ours satisfies its impulses by calling us to testify (in "The Chronicles of Riddick" there were only the desiring concubines in the frame). There is no weaving fantasy. The world around the protagonist is missing. Credible enemies are missing. But Riddick and Vin Diesel have closed (their) circle, and basically that is enough.

title: News of the World
actors: Tom Hanks, Helena Zengel, Mare Winningham, Ray McKinnon, Elizabeth Marvel, Michael Angelo Covino, Fred Hechinger, Neil Sandilands, Winsome Brown
description: Five years after the end of the American Civil War, Captain Jefferson Kyle Kidd, a widower and veteran who fought three wars, travels from city to city as a storyteller, telling stories of presidents, queens, glorious feuds, devastating catastrophes and thrilling adventures from remotest places in the world. On the plains of Texas, he meets Johanna, a ten-year-old girl who was welcomed by the Kiowa six years earlier and raised as one of them. Hostile to a world she has never experienced, Johanna must be returned against her will to her biological aunt and uncle. Kidd agrees to accompany the baby but, as they travel hundreds of miles into the wilderness, the two find themselves facing enormous challenges, both human and natural, as they search for a place they can both call home.

Once again, not even a bandit arrives alive at the court, but Parker decides to reconfirm El Grinta in his role.
notes: Anonymous Western was the penultimate film made by a now sick old John Wayne.

description: Plot in preparation

description: For generations, the people of the city of Ember lived in peace and prosperity underground thanks to the immense generator that provided abundant light. Unfortunately, however, the powerful machine had an expiration date and after 200 years its generous activity has come to an end. It will be up to Lina and Doom, two teenagers, to face the blackout that is about to condemn their extraordinary city, in a race against time destined to unravel the ancient mystery of the foundation and to help their fellow citizens to escape from the darkness that is about to close on them.
notes: Based on the novel of the same name by Jeanne DuPrau, Ember. The Mystery of the City of Light is an adventure for children, with mysterious maps, puzzles, vast dungeons and a healthy sense of wonder (even at the cost of unlikely solutions). If the adults are lost in games of power and greed, crushed by disillusionment or intoxicated by mystical fantasies, it remains for the two young people to seek an escape from the city, whose energy generator is unraveling. A fairytale structure made with grace and wrapped in an original and wonderful place.

title: Cattle Drive
actors: Joel McCrea, Dean Stockwell, Chill Wills, Leon Ames, Henry Brandon

title: Suburban Commando
actors: Hulk Hogan, Christopher Lloyd, Shelley Duvall, Larry Miner
description: We are on the quiet outskirts of any American city where the incredible suddenly happens. An extraterrestrial warrior swoops from interplanetary space, chased by none other than fierce alien bounty hunters. Shep, this is the name of the fugitive, finds refuge in the home of an anonymous couple, Charlie and Jenny Wilcox who are thus involved in the battle.
notes: The idea is to mount a comedy on a science fiction plot, focusing on the ironic presence of a wrestling star as the protagonist. An extremely odd idea: Christopher Lloyd, Shelley Duvall and some decent gags are not enough to keep the level of the film high.

title: Stone Cold
actors: Brian Bosworth, Lance Henriksen, William Forsythe
description: A policeman, Joe Huff, suspended from service for insubordination, witnesses a shooting in a supermarket caused by some thugs on motorcycles. Jeff reacts and takes out the thugs. At this point the FBI forces him to infiltrate the gang where he enters the graces of the grim boss, Chains, and falls in love with Nancy, his woman. This, however, will betray him by revealing his true identity ...
notes: Unsuccessful attempt to throw former American football champion Brian Bosworth, a blonde with a square jaw but with a dull expression, into the cinema. Discreetly shoot the numerous chase sequences and endless shootings.

title: Drag Me to Hell
actors: Alison Lohman, Justin Long, Lorna Raver, Dileep Rao, David Paymer, Adriana Barraza, Chelcie Ross, Reggie Lee, Molly Cheek, Bojana Novakovic
description: Christine works in a bank and is in charge of evaluating possible loans. After denying a mortgage on the house of an old gypsy, she becomes the victim of a curse that turns her life into real hell. The only hope for Christine is the help of a visionary, capable of saving her from the demon that has taken possession of her soul.
notes: The filmmaker of _The House_ and _The Army of Darkness_ is back: irreverent, naughty, a little lousy and daring as in the 80s and its surroundings, the last great author, artist and craftsman of genre and degeneration. Laughter, screams, disgust and reflection. Few means, great cinema.

title: Beast of Burden
actors: Daniel Radcliffe, Pablo Schreiber, Grace Gummer, Renée Willett, John Gettier, Sean Glover, Alec Heroux, Ashton Tatum, David Joseph Martinez, Mark Smith
description: Sean Haggerty only has one hour to deliver illegal cargo. An hour to reassure a drug cartel, a killer and the Goddess that everything is going well. An hour to make sure your wife survives. An hour in which he has to do everything from the cockpit of his Cessna.

notes: Adaptation of the novel of the same name by Kate DiCamillo.

But all this changes when her father brings her an old music box one evening that promises to grant seven of her wishes. Skeptical at first, she realizes that every desire is fulfilled thereby improving her existence. Soon though, the people closest to her start dying in violent and elaborate ways after each wish.

title: Montana
actors: Errol Flynn, Alexis Smith, S. Z. Sakall, Douglas Kennedy
description: An Australian sheep farmer clashes with Montana cattle ranchers, who want to reserve grazing only for their herds. A modest film, with star Errol Flynn now on the avenue of sunset.

actors: Katie Maguire, Catherine A. Callahan, Marie Maser, Kayla Lian, Mike Giannelli, Sydney Freihofer, Cole Mathewson, Michael Chmiel, Marissa Wolf, Minna Taylor
description: Sarah spends Halloween night working as a babysitter, keeping an eye on little Tia and Timmy throughout the evening. The boy discovers that he has received an anonymous videotape, without title and without cover. After some hesitation, the woman decides to show the mysterious tape to the children. The content will turn Halloween night into hell.

title: Happy Death Day
actors: Jessica Rothe, Israel Broussard, Ruby Modine, Rachel Matthews, Charles Aitken, Laura Clifton, Phi Vu, Jason Bayle
description: Student Tree relives the day of her murder discovering unexpected and terrifying details each time. The time cycle will only come to an end when he discovers the identity of his own killer.

title: Grey Owl
actors: Pierce Brosnan, Annie Galipeau, Graham Greene, Nathaniel Arcand
description: Archie, an English trapper born in Hastings and transplanted to Canada, is a man of the woods who lives by hunting fur animals and selling beaver skins. One day he has a shock: the animals are the children of Manitou, why kill them? The man converts to the environmental cause, is mistaken for an Indian, since he calls himself Gray Owl, and begins to preach respect for nature in front of Western tourists.
notes: Richard Attenborough's film is really a film for tourists, a brochure full of beautiful new age expressions and radical chic environmentalism. Cinema not even talking about it: even the incredible scenarios of Canada are mortified by a pompous but never vibrant direction.

title: Dolls
actors: Ian Patrick Williams, Carolyn Purdy-Gordon, Carrie Lorraine, Guy Rolfe, Hilary Mason, Bunty Bailey, Cassie Stuart, Stephen Lee
description: A family finds themselves in the midst of a storm during a trip and finds refuge in a country house whose owners build truly "special" dolls: a collection of devilish objects with which the family will have to compete.

title: Outcast
actors: John Derek, Joan Evans, Jim Davis
description: Cowboy Jet returns to the country after a long absence to reclaim the family ranch his uncle has taken over. All predictable, with a lot of action.

title: Spawn
actors: Melinda Clark, Martin Sheen, Theresa Randle, Michael Jai White, John Leguizamo
description: Five years after being murdered by American intelligence colleagues, Al Simmons makes a pact with the devil to return to earth and see Wanda, the woman of his life. Al is resurrected in the guise of Spawn, a knight of darkness with a disfigured face with the task of leading the devil's army in the destruction of the human race.
notes: Based on the comic of the same name designed by Todd McFarlane, the frilm vaguely resembles "The Crow", a cult film also derived from a comic strip. But it completely lacks that dark atmosphere that was the winning feature of "The Crow", replaced by a riot of digital effects. Among the performers, a Martin Sheen has become a caricature of himself.

title: Phantom of the Opera
actors: Claude Rains, Nelson Eddy, Susanna Foster, Edgar Barrier, Leo Carrillo, Jane Farrar, J. Edward Bromberg, Fritz Feld, Frank Puglia, Steven Geray, Barbara Everest, Hume Cronyn
description: One of the musicians of the Paris Opera, after being robbed of one of his compositions, in the throes of fury was responsible for a murder. Horribly burned his face, he has since taken refuge in the basement of the theater. From there he reappears as a ghost from time to time, spreading death and ruin in his madness to favor the career of his daughter, chorister of the Opera. Remake of the version made in 1925 with Lon Chaney, it is rather traditional and not very personal. The use of color (quite unusual at the time, especially for a horror movie) allows for some suggestive solutions. Oscar in photography and scenography.

title: Fast & Furious 7
actors: Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Dwayne Johnson, Michelle Rodriguez, Kurt Russell, Jason Statham, Tyrese Gibson, Ludacris, Jordana Brewster, Djimon Hounsou, Nathalie Emmanuel, Lucas Black, Romeo Santos

To help Toretto and his men will be an enigmatic government agent (Kurt Russell), who offers them in exchange for help to test a secret federal device on their cars.
notes: Reinventing 007's exotic travelogue, Dom and his team travel from Azerbaijan to Abu Dhabi in a succession of dizzyingly virtuosic set pieces, assembled with scientific, molecular precision. Everything is over the top. Pure Corman gangsta rap. With moments of open stage applause.

description: A consultant for a large company, a young woman is sent to a remote top secret location, where she is tasked with investigating a terrifying incident. He will soon discover that the event was triggered by a human presence, apparently innocent but surrounded by a mystery as promising as it is dangerous.

title: Killing Season
actors: Robert De Niro, John Travolta, Milo Ventimiglia, Elizabeth Olin
description: Benjamin Ford (Robert De Niro) is a former American soldier who fought on the front lines during the conflict in Bosnia. To try to forget the horrors he witnessed and remove the most painful memories of a past that continues to haunt him, he retired to live in an isolated cabin in the Rocky Mountains. Here, however, he soon runs into Emil Kovac (John Travolta), a former soldier of Serbian origin who has arrived there to close some unfinished business. Their meeting will spark a close physical and psychological warfare during which old wounds will reopen and the secrets of both will be revealed.

title: To Love and Die
actors: Shiri Appleby, Ivan Sergei, Kristin Dattilo, Christine Adams, Bradley Stryker, Tyron Leitso, Peter Benson, Don S. Davis, Seymour Cassel, Frances Fisher
description: After yet another sentimental failure, Hildy becomes convinced that her problems stem from being abandoned by her father as a child. He then decides to find him and, when he manages to track him down, he discovers that he is a hired killer. The girl decides to become her father's helper ...

title: Mannequin
actors: Andrew McCarthy, Kim Cattrall, Estelle Getty, James Spader, G.W. Bailey, Carole Davis, Steve Vinovich, Christopher Maher, Meshach Taylor, Phyllis Newman
description: After doing a thousand jobs, losing them all due to an excess of ideas, Jonathan manages to get hired at a department store. Here he comes into contact with a strange mannequin who, when they are alone, comes to life and reveals to be the reincarnation of an Egyptian princess of the pharaonic era. Jonathan, thanks to the charm of the mannequin, leads the warehouse to success and arouses the jealousy of the competitors. These first try to make him look crazy and then to destroy the mannequin: but it's all in vain. The story develops hackneyed ideas; in turn, the jokes, which could give a little salt to the farce, are not even funny: to be forgotten.

title: Pursuit of Honor
actors: Don Johnson, Craig Sheffer, Gabrielle Anwar, Rod Steiger
description: In the mid-thirties the United States was oppressed by a serious economic crisis and the armed forces were also affected by the economic problems that afflict the country. General McArthur in the mood to cut the excessive costs burdening his unit decides to have the excess horses killed. Lieutenant Marsh and Major Libbey disagree and begin an escape across Montana to try and rescue the herd. A TV movie in the classic rural tradition, it is partly saved for the good cast.

title: Hell Bent
actors: Harry Carey, Neva Gerber, Joe Harris, Duke R. Lee, Vester Pegg
description: Cheyenne Harry (Harry Carey) arrives in the town of Rawhide where he meets young Bett (Neva Gerber) who works in the saloon to support her sick elderly mother. Beau Ross (Joe Harris) is the leader of a gang of outlaws operating in the region who, infatuated with Bett, will not hesitate to kidnap her.

actors: Haley Lu Richardson, BooBoo Stewart, Max Charles, Nicole Fox, Michael Welch, Jon Gries, Michael Massee, Rena Owen, Leo Lee, Barbara Crampton

In an Oregon valley particularly hit by drought, a greedy "water baron" is determined to wipe out any survivors using even the most violent means. Only Kendal, a courageous seventeen-year-old more mature than her age, will be able to fight for what is right with determination and determination.

actors: Steven Seagal, Tanoai Reed, Jenna Harrison, Linden Ashby, Emma Catherwood, Stephen Hagan, Daniel Percival, Skye Bennett, Tania Dobre, Mihaela Constantin

actors: Peter Lorre, Boris Karloff, Bela Lugosi, Kay Kyser, Dennis O'Keefe

description: The inhabitants of a mountain village all disappear one bad day, sucked into a demonic entity known as "the ancient enemy", Chaos. A sheriff and a journalist, a former Oxford professor considered somewhat heretical by the academic world) seek a painless way to save humanity from the end (with the help of the army and two unfortunate maidens).
notes: Directed by serial horror craftsman Joe Chappelle, "Phantoms" is actually a film by Dean R. Koontz, the poor man's Stephen King. A bad story and a bad film with little suspense, a routine staging and a certain sloppiness of the performers.

title: Red Sands
actors: Shane West, Leonard Roberts, Aldis Hodge, Callum Blue, Brendan Miller, Theo Rossi, Noel Gugliemi, Mercedes Masöhn, Govinda Touzene, Andrew Elvis Miller
description: According to an ancient legend handed down by the Afghan people, the Djinn are ancestral spirits made of fire, who can take any shape and want to dominate the world and humans. The only way to stop them is to imprison them in vessels similar to the mythical Aladdin's lamp. A squadron of American soldiers at the front has the bad idea of ??blowing up a statue, causing a Djinn to wake up. The monster is terribly thirsty for blood and revenge.
notes: Hallucinated horror with undoubtedly original assumptions, even if the idea of ??an evil and monstrous version of the genie of the Thousand and One Nights lamp can be almost ridiculous to Western audiences.

title: Alien Origin
actors: Chelsea Vincent, Peter Pedrero, Philip Coc, Trey McCurley, Daniela Flynn, Andres Rash, Kent Noralez, Rupert Tablada, Saul Pech, Mjr. John Frear
description: Journalist Julia Evans (Chelsea Vincent) is granted authorization to join the military in Belize, engaged in the capture of rebels and terrorists. As the expedition proceeds filmed by their cameras, the group will come across a terrifying truth about the origins of life on earth, involving a mysterious alien spacecraft.

title: Supercroc
actors: Kim Little, Cynthia Rose Hall, Matthew Blashaw, David Novak, Allen Duncan, Ernesto Galan, Marat Glazer, Garth R. Hassell, Kristen Quintrall, Shaley Scott
description: A small squad of soldiers, joined by a zoologist, is sent to Northern Los Angeles to hunt down a dangerous giant crocodile, which infests the waters of a lake, terrorizing the population. Apparently the animal comes out of the water and kills people because it is looking for some eggs that have been taken away from it. The fight between man and beast will be ruthless ...
notes: Beyond its remarkable pearls of improbability (how did a crocodile arrive in a Los Angeles pond? And where does it find the skills to attack a helicopter in flight?), This umpteenth movie about "bad animals" is silly, with terrible special effects and ridiculous dialogues. Pure Z series.

title: Old Henry
actors: Stephen Dorff, Tim Blake Nelson, Richard Speight Jr., Max Arciniega, Brad Carter, Trace Adkins, Scott Haze, Gavin Lewis, Kent Shelton
description: Henry (Tim Blake Nelson), a widowed farmer, and his son Wyatt (Gavin Lewis) welcome an injured man named Curry (Scott Haze) into their home who carries a bag full of cash. But when a gang hunts for money arrives at their farm, Henry will have to decide who to trust.

title: Bloodsport 2
actors: Daniel Bernhardt, Don Gibb, James Hong, Pat Morita
description: Alex is a thief who as a prisoner learns the secrets of martial arts. His teacher is the wise Sun. Alex learns that the sword he stole from a wealthy art collector is the trophy for the winner of the Kumite, the toughest martial arts tournament in the world. Now redeemed from his past life, he returns it to its rightful owner, to then conquer it regularly in combat. "Bloodsport" ("No holds barred") had the function of launching the Van Damme myth. No. 2 tries to exploit his memory, using an imitation of the now famous Belgian as the protagonist. Full throttle action; history is optional.

title: The Premature Burial
actors: Ray Milland, Hazel Court, Richard Ney, Heather Angel, Alan Napier
description: Guy Garrel (Ray Milland) is terrified of being buried alive. He marries Emily, daughter of his master, Dr. Gault, and has a coffin built for a possible spill. When Garrel finds out that his father has been buried while still alive, he suffers a seemingly deadly shock. Inspired only vaguely by Edgar Allan Poe, Corman creates a film that is typically his own: without great means, hypnotic rhythm, visionary surges accentuated by bright colors. Instead of the usual Vincent Price here is MIlland, who is doing very well.

title: The Mephisto Waltz
actors: Alan Alda, Jacqueline Bisset, Curt Jurgens
description: A mediocre pianist finds the easiest way to success and increase his talent. A nice pact with Satan through his emissary Roxanne, daughter of a great musician who recently passed away. The pianist's wife senses that something evil is happening to her husband and goes to counterattack.
notes: The plot is incredibly confusing. At a certain point it is no longer clear who is embodied in whom and how many characters decide to sacrifice themselves to the devil. Which is, as is known, a woman. Wendkos, however, does not hold back in terms of scares and at least the atmosphere is the right one. Gorgeous Jacqueline Bisset.

title: Air Rage
actors: Ice T, Cyril O'Reilly, Rick Cramer, Kimberly Oja, Alexandra Raines
description: Found guilty of heinous war crimes, Marine Colonel Skikes is sentenced to life in military prison. His loyalists, however, manage to make him escape, and with him at the head they hijack a plane to obtain a strong ransom. There is work for Matt Marshall and his counterterrorism unit ...
notes: Fred Olen Ray, a brand a guarantee: according to the annals, our company would have signed - both in its own name and with a plethora of pseudonyms - the beauty of 93 films from 1971 to 2006! Seven in 2001 alone, one of which is this _Air Rage_: and the reader will forgive us, if at this point we have run out of space for further comments ...

title: So Red the Rose
actors: Margaret Sullavan, Randolph Scott, Walter Connolly, Robert Cumming
description: The misfortunes of a wealthy southern U.S. planter family during the Civil War. The young Valette sees her brother Edward die and, after the defeat of the Confederates, she also loses contact with her cousin Duncan, with whom she is in love. However, the defeat did not destroy everything and the two young men manage to marry and return to their land to try to rebuild, at least in part, the ancient plantation. The idea was good and came four years earlier than Gone with the Wind. The result is pleasant, but economically it was a disaster.

title: The Getaway
actors: Steve McQueen, Ali MacGraw, Ben Johnson, Al Lettieri, Sally Struthers, Slim Pickens, Richard Bright, Jack Dodson, Dub Taylor
description: A politician manages to get Doc, a hardened criminal, out of prison before he has served his entire sentence; in exchange the latter has to rob a bank for him. The blow is scored with some accomplices who, however, compete for the booty. Doc escapes to Mexico with his money and his wife, chased by his accomplice, whom he had thought dead, and by the police. However, the road is very long and the dangers are always lurking. Will the skilled Doc succeed in his intent?
notes: From a Jim Thompson novel, adapted and scripted by Walter Hill, Peckinpah directs the only detective story of his career. The director of the "Wild Bunch" transforms the escape to freedom of the robber and his beautiful and courageous wife into a contemporary western. Deadly traps, a chase to the last breath and an unpredictable ending. An opaque remake of the film was shot in 1994.

title: Soldier of Fortune
actors: Clark Gable, Susan Hayward, Michael Rennie, Gene Barry
description: An American reporter mysteriously disappears in Hong Kong. His wife then goes to the Asian city to find out what happened to her husband. Here the inspector following the investigation suggests that the woman seek help from an American adventurer who has been in Asia for years. The man agrees to help her and ends up falling in love with her ...
notes: Edward Dmytryk, shooting in Hong Kong, manages to create discreet atmospheres, also capturing the peculiarities of the environment. The interpreters are quite persuasive, a Clark Gable who starts at dusk but keeps his charm intact, and a Susan Hayward who goes along well with him.

title: A Force of One
actors: Chuck Norris, Jennifer O'Neill, Clu Gulager, Ron O'Neal
description: A deadly new drug is spreading on the California coast. But the traffickers are defeated by a martial arts cop who has the expressionless face of Chuck Norris early in his career. The director is Paul Aaron, but, to tell the truth, nothing changes and the story has nothing original. Follow-up to "Commando Black Tigers" by Ted Post, director and producer of some successful TV series.

title: Westworld
actors: Yul Brynner, Richard Benjamin, James Brolin, Victoria Shaw
description: We are in Delos, a vacation spot for the earthlings of the near future. Divided by historical epochs and populated by suitably clad robots, it allows tourists to "live" adventures of all kinds without danger. But for Peter and John something goes wrong: the robots start to rebel and the plunge into the Old West turns into a tragic nightmare, from which it seems impossible to find a way out.
notes: Crichton is a novelist and director who awakens the most disturbing hallucinations linked to scientific progress (see "Jurassic Park"). Here he creates a western fantasy full of suspense and gimmicks, with a hypnotic Brinner.

title: Lust for Gold
actors: Ida Lupino, Glenn Ford, Gig Young
description: A boy sets out in search of the gold mine his grandfather discovered in Arizona a hundred years earlier. The man had been hunted by a woman who wanted to steal the map with the location of the mine and killed her and her husband.
notes: Anomalous dramatic western told with many flashbacks that enliven the narrative.

title: Rocky Mountain
actors: Errol Flynn, Patrice Wymore, Scott Forbes
description: At the beginning of 1865 the American Civil War seems marked for the southerners. General Lee entrusts Captain Lafe Barstow with the task of recruiting new soldiers even among the outlaws. On the way to the Rocky Mountains, however, he will also have to guard against the threatening presence of the Indians.
notes: A routine film that has the only characteristic of being the last western starring Erroll Flynn.

title: Phantasm: Ravager
actors: Angus Scrimm, Reggie Bannister, A. Michael Baldwin, Kathy Lester, Bill Thornbury, Daniel Schweiger, Gloria Lynne Henry, Cean Okada, Jay Oliva, Daniel Roebuck
description: From time immemorial Reggie, a former ice cream seller, has been on a constant search for his greatest enemy, the evil Tall Man. He will finally be forced to confront the mysteries of death and the strange spheres that rage in the sky.
notes: Fourth chapter of the Ghosts saga, created by Don Coscarelli in 1979.

title: Bound by Honor
actors: Damian Chapa, Jesse Borrego, Benjamin Bratt, Enrique Castillo, Delroy Lindo
description: Half brothers Paco and Cruz and cousin Miklo in 1972 are part of a Los Angeles gang known as the Vatos Locos. Their existence is marked by violent crime and drugs until their fates take different paths: Miklo ends up in San Quentin prison, Cruz becomes an exceptional artist but addicted to heroin and Paco, ironically, becomes a policeman.

title: Last of the Redmen
actors: Jon Hall, Michael O'Shea, Evelyn Ankers
description: Two young ladies and a boy, the sons of an English general, cross the territories of North America infested with aggressive Indian tribes under escort. A noble and courageous Mohican, the only survivor of his people, acts as their defender and guide. This version of the Fenimore Cooper novel is neither the best nor the worst.

title: Gale Force
actors: Treat Williams, Michael Dudikoff, Paul Logan, Renee Ridgeley
description: Sam, a Los Angeles detective, takes part in a reality TV show: along with three other contestants he must hunt for a treasure (10 million dollars in cash) hidden on a wild island. to spoil the show is Jared, at the head of a militia armed to the teeth, who lands on the island to get his hands on the loot. An easy task, but only apparently: because the timid Sam and his improvised comrades in arms manage to prevent the group from leaving the island with the treasure, and then nature gets involved, unleashing a hurricane that risks making a square clean of all.

title: Four for Texas
actors: Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, Anita Ekberg, Ursula Andress
description: Joe and Zack are two adventurers who fortunately came into possession of the sum of one hundred thousand dollars. Joe wants to install a gambling house on a boat. Zack deals with a shady banker to make his life difficult, but when the banker manifests his true purposes, Joe and Zack team up and manage to knock him out, thus cementing their friendship. Stellar cast (both in the couple of protagonists and in the two side bellone) for Aldrich who gives us a western not without irony. If the film never takes itself seriously and fails to reach the scatentao rhythm it set itself, there are still some enjoyable moments.

title: Witchboard
actors: Todd Allen, Tawny Kitaen, Stephen Nichols, Cathleen Wilhoite
description: During a party with friends, Brandon exhibits a tablet full of strange inscriptions, the "ouija", a kind of tool for summoning spirits. An experiment is then attempted by evoking the spirit of David. Handcrafted horror as it is not done anymore.

title: At Sword's Point
actors: Cornel Wilde, Maureen O'Hara, Robert Douglas, Gladys Cooper, June Clayworth, Dan O'Herlihy, Alan Hale jr., Blanche Yurka, Nancy Gates
description: Although Louis XIII, dying, left a minor heir as heir to the throne, the Duke of Lavalle actually dominates the kingdom of France, with the intention of marrying the Queen's daughter and thus making his power legitimate. The children of the famous musketeers, three young men and a girl arrive to help the sovereign. Never four will have their problems returning the throne to the Dauphin.
notes: Some good duels, but there is little new compared to the other films in the series. Allen directs with impeccable rhythm, the actors are the right ones.

title: Vibes
actors: Cyndi Lauper, Jeff Goldblum, Peter Falk, Michael Lerner
description: Harry Buscafusco's son has mysteriously disappeared in the mountains of Ecuador. To find him, Harry hires two psychics: Nick and Sylvia. The trio sets off for South America, but it quickly becomes clear that Buscafusco has no children, much less dispersed. His only hope is to get his hands on a fabulous Indian treasure ...
notes: Lowell Ganz and Babaloo Mandel are two highly respected comedy writers (including _Scappo dalla città_). Cyndi Lauper, in her first starring role, is the lead singer of _Girls Just Want to Have Fun_. Here, however, hardly anyone has fun. Also wasted the big names of the cast, from Jeff Goldblum to Peter Falk.

title: Gutshot Straight
actors: George Eads, AnnaLynne McCord, Steven Seagal, Ted Levine, Vinnie Jones, Stephen Lang, Tia Carrere, Fiona Dourif, Elsie Fisher, John Lewis
description: A professional poker player named Jack, in a moment of little luck, makes a deal with Duffy, a rich and underworld man from Las Vegas, to make some quick cash and pay off his debts. But when the deal turns into something dangerous, Jack must learn to be smarter than his enemies in order to move forward and protect his family by asking a loan shark for help.

title: Bad Boys II
actors: Martin Lawrence, Will Smith, Jordi Mollà, Gabrielle Union, Peter Stormare, Joe Pantoliano
description: Miami narcotics team detectives Mike Lowrey and Marcus Burnett are on a task force to stem the spread of ecstasy in the city. Unintentionally, they discover a grandiose conspiracy involving a ruthless drug lord, willing to kill anyone who intrudes on his plans to control all drug trafficking. To complicate the situation comes Syd, Marcus's sister and undercover agent of the drug team.
notes: In other times, it would have been a harmless C-series short film, ironic and quick. With producer Bruckheimer's estrogen, it becomes a kind of bewildering blockbuster, inexplicably lasting two and a half hours and piling up chases with thirty crashed cars or slow motion scenes of a bullet piercing Martin Lawrence's buttock.

title: Firewalker
actors: Chuck Norris, Louis Gossett jr., Melody Anderson, Will Sampson
description: Max Donigan and Leo Porter are two adventurers. They learn of a fabulous treasure hidden in the basement of an Aztec temple. The two, flanked by a girl, Melody, in possession of a magical dagger, set off in search. They are opposed by the natives but, after a thousand adventures, they manage to take possession of the treasure.
notes: Fourth hand history and predictable smashing developments.

title: The Beast
actors: William Petersen, Karen Sillas, Charles Martin Smith, Ronald Guttman
description: The small coastal community of Graves Point is devastated by the tragic and inexplicable disappearance of a young couple at sea. After some inspections, Dr. Talley - a marine biologist - believes that he has found the mystery solved: a very rare and enormous squid would wander in the depths ...

title: The Big Circus
actors: Victor Mature, Rhonda Fleming, Peter Lorre, Red Buttons, Vincent Price
description: In order to obtain a loan, the owner (Mature) of a circus accepts the presence of the administrator (Fleming) sent by the bank. Film not very original, but which has a good fluidity of development. Worth a look at least for Peter Lorre who is a clown.

title: Mongolian Death Worm
actors: Sean Patrick Flanery, Victoria Pratt, George Cheung, Drew Waters, Matthew Tompkins, Nate Rubin, Jon Mack, Tiger Sheu, Ryan Manalansan, Cheryl Chin
description: An American oil company builds a research well in the vast Mongolian desert. During the excavations, however, they come across something terrible that was lying underground and that should not be disturbed. The deadly creatures that have emerged from underground begin to reproduce and disperse, devouring everything in their path.

title: The Frozen Dead
actors: Dana Andrews, Anna Palk, Philip Gilbert, Karel Stepanek
description: Dr. Norberg (Andrews) keeps the hibernating bodies of some Third Reich hierarchs in his laboratory near London. When he is ordered to "thaw" them in view of a future Nazi rescue, a series of terrifying events begins that will end only thanks to the force of the thought of a girl whose head is detached from her body. Shot in England, the film is definitely on the heavy side in terms of gruesome visions, but the clumsy script by Herbert J. Leder, also producer and director, does not know how to put such a heap of horrors to good use. Too bad, because the idea was really bizarre.

title: Gun Belt
actors: George Montgomery, Tab Hunter, Helen Westcott, John Delmer, William Bishop, Jack Elam, Douglas Kennedy, James Millican, Hugh Sanders
description: Billy Ringo, the bravest of Tombstone's riflemen, decides to hang up his rifle and lead a normal life. The cowboy has met a young milliner and is looking forward to starting a new life. To his misfortune, his brother Matt is not of the same idea as he organizes a bank heist and tries to involve Billy as well. Matt ends up killed and the blame seems to fall on his brother who can barely escape the lynching of the crowd.
notes: A beautiful photograph and a decent script put this western a step above the routine. Chases and shootings are wasted.

title: The Eye
actors: Jessica Alba, Rade Serbedzija, Parker Posey, Alessandro Nivola, Fernanda Romero, Rachel Ticotin, Obba Babatundé, Danny Mora, Chloë Grace Moretz, Brett Haworth
description: Sidney Wells is a famous violinist who has been blind since the age of five. Sister Helen, who has always felt responsible for her blindness, however, has a cornea transplant planned for her which should give her back the use of her eyes. The operation seems to be successful, but the girl begins to see dead people everywhere. What is worse is that the clearer the view becomes, the more monstrosity of the visions increases. Who did Sidney's new corneas belong to?
notes: Remake of Hong Kong's _The Eye_ by the Pang brothers, it makes extensive use of digital for gruesome appearances. Able to satisfy undemanding palates, however, it does not shine for inventiveness.

title: Neon City
actors: Michael Ironside, Vanity, Lyle Alzado, Valerie Wildman, Nick Klar, Juliet Landau, Arsenio 'Sonny' Trinidad, Richard Sanders, Monte Markham
description: The bounty hunter Henry Stark must cross a vast and desolate expanse to reach, together with his prisoner, the city of Neon City. There you will be able to claim the prize. The territory that the two must cross is fraught with danger: attacks by criminal mutants and the presence of a lethal toxic cloud. They are joined by a small group of stragglers and the adventure begins.
notes: It is not difficult to see a distant reference to the adventures of Mad Max: the ruins of a post-technological history of risky nomadism are not exactly a novelty in the cinema. But one can always console oneself by admiring Vanity's graces.

title: Death Wish
actors: Bruce Willis, Vincent D'Onofrio, Elisabeth Shue, Camila Morrone, Dean Norris, Beau Knapp, Kimberly Elise, Len Cariou, Jack Kesy, Ronnie Gene Blevins, Kirby Bliss Blanton
description: Paul Kersey, a Chicago surgeon, is a docile family man who finds himself re-prioritizing his life after his wife and daughter are victims of a violent raid on their home. Moved by the desire for revenge, he will stop at nothing to achieve his goal.
notes: Remake of The Night Vigilant (1974).

title: When Worlds Collide
actors: Richard Derr
description: Two planets that have entered the orbit of the Earth, condemn the planet to imminent destruction. Naive science fiction produced by George Pal. Oscar for special effects, some of which still maintain a certain effectiveness today.

title: Air Collision
actors: Reginald VelJohnson, Jordan Ladd, Gerald Webb, Michael Teh, Darin Cooper, Darren Anthony Thomas, Andy Clemence, Meredith Thomas, Stephanie Hullar, Caryn Ward
description: A solar storm wipes out the air traffic control system. Air Force One passengers and airliners find themselves on a collision course in the skies over the Midwest.

title: Escape Room
actors: Taylor Russell, Logan Miller, Deborah Ann Woll, Jay Ellis, Tyler Labine, Nik Dodani, Yorick Van Wageningen, Jessica Sutton, Adam Robitel, Jamie-Lee Money, Kenneth Fok
description: Six strangers find themselves in an impenetrable escape room, forced to manage a situation that, completely out of their control, requires intelligence and ingenuity to find clues and escape death.

title: Navy Seals
actors: Charlie Sheen, Michael Biehn, Joanne Whalley
description: In the army of the United States of America, a special group called "Seals" is trained according to the harshest laws of selection. The men who are part of it must always be ready for anything. The group is sent to the Middle East on the trail of terrorist Ben Shaheed, and the missiles he possesses. Some vicissitudes lead them to Lebanon where a bloody clash will take place with the killing of the terrorists.
notes: In the beginning it was "That dirty dozen" then the various "Top Guns". However, the direction of Lewis Teague, better known as a horror director, is interesting.

title: Rollerball
actors: Chris Klein, Jean Reno, LL Cool J, Rebecca Romijn
description: Year of Grace, 2005. Jonathan Cross is the most popular rollerball champion a violent evolution of skating hockey. Together with Marcus Ridley, his childhood friend and the beautiful Aurora, he sets the crowds on fire with passion and earns tons of money. Jonathan realizes too late that Alexi Petrovic, the inventor of the game, makes up matches so that the dead man always escapes. Doing so is sure to spark interest in the public and bettors.
notes: Poor John McTiernan has seen the film upset in post production, so you don't understand anything about characters and situations. The pitiful packaging, with funfair pyrotechnic effects, however, is also his fault.

title: Hell Asylum
actors: Debra Mayer, Tanya Dempsey, Joe Estevez, Stacey Scowley

title: Six Black Horses
actors: Audie Murphy, Dan Duryea, Joan O'Brien, Bob Steele, Roy Barcroft
description: Ben and Frank are hired by the mysterious Kelly to escort her home through Indian territory. Along the way, Kelly offers Ben the entire agreed fee in exchange for the life of Frank, who had previously killed her husband ...
notes: Written by specialist Burt Kennedy, collaborator - among others - of Budd Boetticher.

title: The Rundown
actors: Dwayne Johnson, Seann William Scott, Rosario Dawson, Christopher Walken, Ewen Bremner, Jon Gries
description: A man instructs Beck, a guy accustomed to recovering what is asked of him by any means, to bring home his son Travis, who has long since gone on a trip to Brazil. However, the mission turns out to be more difficult than expected, not only because the boy has no intention of returning, but also because there are a couple of complications: Mariana, a young local who knows the mysteries of the jungle, and Hatcher, a tyrant. madman who uses the jungle and its inhabitants to make his fortune ... Without making any claims, the film succeeds in its intent of mixing action and comedy in a funny collage with engaging stunt sequences.

title: Call of the Wild
actors: Christopher Lloyd, Timothy Bottoms, Veronica Cartwright, Christopher Dempsey, Joyce Dewitt, Ariel Gade, Devon Graye, Devon Iott, Kameron Knox, Russell Snyder
description: Little Ryann is welcomed by her grandfather to spend two weeks with him, in Montana, on the occasion of a parents' trip. When one night she finds a wounded wolf near the pigsty, the little girl will decide to help him, and then take him to live with her in Boston. But the grandfather knows that it is only a matter of time for the animal to feel the need to return to its wild life.
notes: The adaptation of the London text is limited to reading the novel that an unbearable child, materialistic but ready to convert after about ten minutes in the mountains, listens to her grandfather before going to bed. The film was released in theaters in a rather useless 3D version.

title: Soylent Green
actors: Charlton Heston, Edward G. Robinson, Joseph Cotten, Chuck Connors, Dick Van Patten
description: In a world starving for overpopulation, two policemen discover that a food company, Soylent, is recycling human corpses.
notes: Some forgivable inconsistency for the liveliness of the whole and some moments of real tension. Beautiful settings in a decadent nocturnal New York, excellent actors. For Edward G. Robinson, this was the last interpretation. One of the best science fiction movies of the 70s.

title: Picture Mommy Dead
actors: Don Ameche, Martha Hyer, Susan Gordon, Zsa Zsa Gabor, Signe Hasso

title: The Purge
actors: Ethan Hawke, Lena Headey, Max Burkholder, Adelaide Kane, Edwin Hodge, Rhys Wakefield, Tony Oller, Alicia Vela-Bailey, Tom Yi, John Weselcouch
description: In an America ravaged by crime and prison overcrowding, the government has established a twelve-hour period per year during which any crime or offense committed is not punished. Within 12 hours, the police cannot be called, hospitals suspend all forms of help and citizens are forced to regulate themselves without thinking too much about the consequences. When an intruder breaks into Sandin's "free" hours and begins a sequence of threatening events, James (Ethan Hawke), wife Mary (Lena Headey) and their children will see their limits tested to protect themselves without transforming themselves. in the monsters they are trying to hide from.
notes: Under the mask of the genre DeMonaco conceals abysmal social and anthropological reflections. The good neighbor of America 3.0 sharpens a cleaver in the yard, preparing for the slaughter. The class clash rekindles the engines, in a hopeless renewal of slave mechanics who want the homeless as picks for the redemption of the bourgeois classes. In DeMonaco's instant cult, the narrative developments are elementary, the characters do not always convince and some screenplay choices do not add up. But the subtexts that feed it respond to a pulsating urgency, the imagery it feeds on is alive and unsettling, the reflections it stimulates bring to light the fears and deep distortions of the social man.

title: Northwest Passage
actors: Spencer Tracy, Robert Young, Ruth Hussey, Walter Brennan
description: Major Rogers is charged with a very dangerous mission: to reach and destroy a camp of Indians (allies of the French) who have massacred a group of English settlers. Their village is located in the intricate and impenetrable virgin forest that hides a thousand human and natural dangers. Once the mission is completed, Rogers is entrusted with the task of finding the passage to the Northwest.
notes: Spectacular and violent adventure film about a group of rough men in the harsh environment of the late 1700s American Great North. It was the first color film made by King Vidor which was to be followed by the part of the search for the Northwest Passage that was not carried out.

title: Innerspace
actors: Dennis Quaid, Martin Short, Meg Ryan, Kevin McCarthy
description: Pilot Tuck Pendelton agrees to undergo a miniaturization experiment to be injected, locked in a capsule, into the body of a rabbit. Instead, he will end up in that of a hypochondriac supermarket clerk. A group of thugs hunt down the latter to get hold of the invention in order to sell it to the highest bidder. In 1966 Viaggio hallucinante proposed a man "inside" another, but here much of the story is seen from the outside. Spielberg produces a film skillfully directed by the whimsical Joe Dante, starring the good Quaid, the no less good Short and (at the time) nice Meg Ryan.

title: Red Tomahawk
actors: Howard Keel, John Caufield, Broderick Crawford, Scott Brady
description: A small town is about to be attacked by the Sioux. But the Indians will have to face the fierce resistance of the population. Naive and stereotyped Western, twenty years late.

title: Bubble Boy
actors: Jake Gyllenhaal, Swoosie Kurtz, Marley Shelton, Danny Trejo, John Carroll Lynch, Verne Troyer
description: A boy is born with no immune system and must live in a plastic bubble in his bedroom.
notes: Remake of _The Boy in the Plastic Bubble_ from 1976 with a very young John Travolta. The director changes and the level of the first film is not maintained. Hint of a road movie. Useless sentimentality.

title: Alien: Covenant
actors: Michael Fassbender, Katherine Waterston, James Franco, Callie Hernandez, Billy Crudup, Carmen Ejogo, Danny McBride, Demián Bichir, Amy Seimetz
description: The crew members of the Covenant spacecraft, charged with colonizing a distant planet, think they are arriving in a paradise. At their destination, they will discover that they are faced with a dark and dangerous world whose only inhabitant is David, an android who survived the Prometheus expedition.

title: Hickok
actors: Luke Hemsworth, Trace Adkins, Kris Kristofferson, Bruce Dern, Cameron Richardson, Kaiwi Lyman-Mersereau, Hunter Fischer, Robert Catrini, Britain Simons, Kimberly Alexander
description: Notorious gunfighter and outlaw "Wild Bill" Hickok tries to escape his past by settling in the small town of Abilene, Kansas. The mayor, fascinated by his gun skills, offers him a job as a sheriff. Soon, a gang of outlaws will threaten Wild Bill and the laws he administers.

title: Hard Ground
actors: Burt Reynolds, Bruce Dern, Martin Kove, Amy Jo Johnson, Seth Peterson, David Figlioli, Larry Hankin
description: Billy Bucklin, a ruthless bandit, escapes on his way to Yuma. He has a plan in mind: to hire a handful of desperados to put the Mexican border on fire. To finance the project, he rob a stagecoach on which wages destined for the military are transported. He also kidnaps a young woman to sell her as a prostitute. Elder Sheriff Hutchinson persuades the governor to pardon another dangerous criminal, John "Chill" MacKay, whom Hutchinson himself arrested, having him sentenced to twenty years for murder. McKay is the sheriff's brother-in-law and is the only one believed to be able to help him hunt down criminals.

title: The Devil's Tomb
actors: Cuba Gooding jr., Valerie Cruz, Ron Perlman, Weston Blakesley, Taryn Manning, Franky G, Zack Ward, Henry Rollins, Jason London, Stephanie Jacobsen, Brandon Fobbs
description: A select group of mercenaries, under the command of war veteran Mack, connects with Elissa, a charming CIA agent, determined to help a scientist working on an archaeological discovery hidden beneath the surface of the Middle Eastern desert. With the help of a mysterious priest, Mack and his team uncover the secret hidden among the immense sandbanks. A terrible truth that has been hidden for thousands of years, and that does not belong to this world.
notes: Cuba Gooding Jr. (Oscar for _Jerry Maguire_), very little credible in the role of veteran Mack, fails to revive the fortunes of this boring, unlikely and banal sci-fi horror.

title: The Intruder Within
actors: Chad Everett, Joseph Bottoms, Jennifer Warren
description: The occupants of an isolated oil rig are threatened by a fearsome primitive creature that has risen from the mysterious abyssal depths. It is a decent television production suitable for those who love to tremble, but in moderation.

title: Dead Rising: Endgame
actors: Jessica Harmon, Marie Avgeropoulos, Billy Zane, Jesse Metcalfe, Keegan Connor Tracy, Dennis Haysbert, Ian Tracey, Patrick Sabongui, Stephen Lobo, Curtis Lum
description: In a zombie-infested quarantine city, investigative journalist Chase Carter attempts to stop a secret government conspiracy that threatens the lives of millions of innocent people.
notes: Follow-up to Dead Rising: Watchtower (2015).

title: 47 Ronin
actors: Keanu Reeves, Hiroyuki Sanada, Tadanobu Asano, Rinko Kikuchi, Kô Shibasaki, Jin Akanishi, Min Tanaka, Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, Neil Fingleton, Togo Igawa
description: After their lord and leader is forced to make harakiri by the will of the grim Lord Kira (Tadanobu Asano), a group of 47 samurai devise a plan to get their revenge and restore honor to their house. Among them, there is also Kai (Keanu Reeves), whose position is not clear to his companions due to the love that the ronin feels for Mika (Kô Shibasaki), the daughter of the deceased master.
notes: The problem with this remake of the film "The Revenge of the 47 Ronin" (1941) is the packaging, and we don't mean the gorgeous scenography and the slightly cloying but gaudy costumes, but the "digital" direction that jumps into an unlikely fantastic dimension with superficial historical reconstructions and a narration reduced to zero degree. We are not far from the latest generation Hollywood “fairy tales” (genre "Hansel & Gretel - Witch hunters"), and also in this case the model, more than the "chanbara" of the samurai, are videogames.

title: Ultraviolet
actors: Milla Jovovich, Cameron Bright, Nick Chinlund, Sebastien Andrieu, William Fichtner, Ida Martin
description: Late 21st century. Humanity has been decimated by an error in bio-genetic experimentation: instead of creating super-soldiers, the virus has transformed people into bloodsucking, vampires who in turn spread the disease. Violet, a splendid vampire who has contracted the virus, must protect Six, a boy who possesses the secret for the salvation of humanity: in fact, the cure for all Bloodsucking flows in her blood.
notes: The film is made up of a series of interminable fights set in an aesthetic that oscillates between the glacial commercial of a trendy amaro and the bar video game. The bodies of the actors portrayed on the computer so as to be similar to the abundant digital animations. A pinball machine, a pixelated imaginary where the cinema is not clear where it is, certainly not in the story and much less in the staging. Milla is good, we know, we have always supported her; but if you throw it away with such crap you can only say that it has a great future behind it.

title: Ella Enchanted
actors: Anne Hathaway, Hugh Dancy, Cary Elwes, Vivica A. Fox, Joanna Lumley, Minnie Driver
description: At the birth of Ella, the fairy Lucinda gives her obedience as a gift.
