But over time, that dowry becomes a kind of curse, because the girl cannot refuse to fulfill what is asked of her and is often at the mercy of unscrupulous individuals. To try to regain control of her life, Ella will have to traverse a realm full of orcs, giants, evil stepsisters and talking books ...
notes: Harmless fairy tale made to measure to enhance the soap and water charm of Hathaway (_Pretty Princess_, but also _The Secrets of Brokeback Mountain_). In the original edition, the narrator is Eric Idle, formerly of Monty Python.

title: Bermuda Tentacles
actors: Trevor Donovan, Linda Hamilton, Mya, John Savage, Jamie Kennedy, Richard Whiten, Ricco Ross, Jeff Rector, Robert Blanche, Angelique Cinelu
description: Air Force One, the American presidential plane, crashes in a storm in the Bermuda Triangle area. The US Navy is tasked with finding the escape pod that houses the President but a giant, sprawling creature emerging from the ocean floor attacks rescuers.

title: Walking Tall
actors: Dwayne Johnson, Johnny Knoxville, Neal McDonough, Kristen Wilson, Ashley Scott
description: After retiring from the Army Special Forces, Chris Vaughn decides to return to the small town he came from to start a new life. When he arrives, however, he realizes that things have gotten considerably worse: drugs, corruption and crime are rampant. At the head of these shady trades is an old acquaintance of Chris: his former schoolmate and rival Jay Hamilton ...
notes: In the midst of a "pre-emptive war" climate, the United States finds a new hero: The Rock, a former wrestler who aspires to take Schwarzenegger's place in the muscular imagination. The film is vulgar and obvious, but at home it was a success.

title: Gacy
actors: Mark Holton, Adam Baldwin, Tom Waldman, Charlie Weber, Allison Lange, Edith Jefferson, Joleen Lutz, Scott Alan Henry, Kenneth Swartz, Matt Farnsworth
description: Wisconsin, 1953. John Gacy sr. forces fat teenage son John jr. to have sex with him during a fishing trip. Sixteen years later, now an adult, John jr. he is accused of sodomy and, having returned to freedom after 18 months, he settles in Des Plains, near Chicago. From 1972 onwards, he became a respected family man and businessman and also attempted a political career with the Democrats. While in public he abhors homosexuality, in private he uses the space under his home to indulge an unsuspected depravity: over 30 innocent boys and teenagers are buried there after being abused in a horrifying and heartbreaking way.
notes: Inspired by a true story.

title: Iron Eagle
actors: Louis Gossett jr., Jason Gedrick, David Suchet, Tim Thomerson
description: Doug is the son of a US Air Force colonel. The boy trembles with impatience to be able to emulate his father's feats, but for now he has to be content with a flight simulator. However, he learns so well that when his parent falls into the hands of Middle Eastern terrorists, he seizes an aircraft and rushes to the rescue. Everything ends well and Doug also earns the long-awaited badges.
notes: Reaganian film of the series "top gun to the rescue", in which Sidney J. Furie gives ample proof of his technical skills during the aerial shots, breathtaking as it should be. But the story and the staging are pure routine.

title: The Bye Bye Man
actors: Carrie-Anne Moss, Faye Dunaway, Douglas Smith, Lucien Laviscount, Cressida Bonas, Doug Jones, Michael Trucco, Erica Tremblay, Cleo King, Marisa Echeverria, Jenna Kanell
description: When they move into an old house near their college campus, three students unwittingly awaken a supernatural entity that haunts those who discover its name. But friends understand that there is a way to escape the curse and prevent it from spreading. However, the entity begins to infer with their thoughts, taking control of them and causing them to commit irreparable acts.

title: YellowBrickRoad
actors: Cassidy Freeman, Anessa Ramsey, Laura Heisler, Clark Freeman, Tara Giordano, Alex Draper, Lee Wilkof, Michael Laurino, Sam Elmore
description: In 1940, in Friar, a small town of 542 inhabitants in the countryside of New Hampshire, inexplicably a large part of the population collected their possessions and went on a mountain path, losing their tracks. An American army team, after careful research, finds their bodies massacred and only one survivor, unable to tell what happened and gone mad. For seventy years that episode remains shrouded in silence until researchers, accompanied by the cameras of some directors, decide to return to the place to ascertain the truth, clashing with the hostility of the local population.

title: Something Evil
actors: Sandy Dennis, Darren McGavin, Ralph Bellamy
description: A little family buys a farm in Pennsylvania. Having taken possession of the house, however, its occupants notice the existence of strange phenomena: the house is infested with otherworldly presences who try to possess the woman and upset the life of the family.
notes: Before making his big screen debut, Spielberg worked extensively for television. Witnesses of those years remain some films including this Something Evil, a horror in which some of the fantastic elements typical of much of his subsequent cinema are already present: from Close Encounters of the III type to Poltergeist produced by him. But in the draft state.

title: Here Alone
actors: Lucy Walters, Adam David Thompson, Gina Piersanti, Shane West, Rebecca Spiro, Mike Lavarnway, Mary Guzzy, Holly Adams, Jonathan Gundel, Aubrey Hart
description: A virus has decimated the human race, leaving only two groups of survivors: on the one hand there are those who managed to avoid infection while on the other hand there are those who have been driven insane, violent and bloodthirsty. Living in the middle of a forest, Ann, Chris and Olivia are forced to fend off the infected. But when an expedition to retrieve food doesn't go as it should, one of them will have to make a terrible choice.

title: House
actors: William Katt, George Wendt
description: Fresh from Vietnam, the abandonment of his wife and the loss of a child, Roger seeks refuge in an empty house. But there all his nightmares assail him. Effective horror with a few touches of irony.

title: Blood Frenzy
actors: Wendy Macdonald, Lisa Loring, John Clark, Hank Garrett, John Montero
description: Seven close friends decide to take a vacation, but even before realizing where they are, the group falls into terror. In fact, a mysterious serial killer sows slaughtered corpses everywhere and soon the seven protagonists have to fight for their lives.
notes: Discounted horror film that turns eerily towards the splatter side. Only for strong palates.

title: Star Trek
actors: Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Eric Bana, Winona Ryder, Zoë Saldana, Karl Urban, Bruce Greenwood, John Cho, Leonard Nimoy, Simon Pegg, Jennifer Morrison, Chris Hemsworth, Anton Yelchin, Ben Cross, Rachel Nichols
description: Yet another adventure of Captain Kirk and the Enterprise, this time in a prequel to the Classic Series, with the meeting between young Kirk (Chris Pine) and Spock (Zachary Quinto) at the time of attending the Academy at the center of the narrative.

title: Street Knight
actors: Jeff Speakman, Christopher Neame, Lewis Van Bergen, Jennifer Gatti
description: Jake hasn't recovered since, in his role as a cop, he unintentionally caused the death of a girl. Now Jake is a mechanic by trade, but the world of crime won't leave him alone. A new fight between gangs of thugs forces him to come out. He will discover that behind it all is a paramilitary organization run by a psychopath named Franklin. This is not a movie, it is an anthology of stereotypes. The result, however, is not unwatchable and Magnoli's direction is not too weak either. But if Richard Friedman (the screenwriter) had come up with at least an original idea ...

title: Yellowstone Kelly
actors: Clint Walker, Edd Byrnes, John Russell, Ray Danton, Andra Martin, Claude Akins, Rhodes Reason, Gary Vinson
description: Yellostowne Kelly, an Indian-friendly white hunter has fallen in love with a squaw whose life he saved. The girl is also courted by the chieftain and his nephew, but she does not reciprocate either of them. Furthermore, an official fanatic insists on trespassing into Indian territory: two different rivalries that lead the Indians to open confrontation. After ups and downs, the squaw wants to return to her village, but Kelly has promised her father, the chieftain, to protect her.
notes: "Progressive" Western with good and bad Indians. But the hero is still a white man. Not Gordon Douglas' best result in the western.

title: Open Grave
actors: Sharlto Copley, Thomas Kretschmann, Josie Ho, Joseph Morgan, Erin Richards, Max Wrottesley, M. Frakes
description: Jonah wakes up in a pit full of corpses without remembering who he is or how he got there. Without any memory, he finds a cabin with five strangers who, like him, do not know who they are or what happened around them. Trying to find a way out of the danger that surrounds them, the six realize that they are not alone and, in a panic, they begin to turn against each other. Through flashbacks, Jonah slowly realizes who he once was, what terrible identity hides behind his teammates and what terrible reality he has to face.
notes: Like the protagonist upon awakening from a bradycardic sleep, even the script (frozen for more than five years before ending up in the hands of the Madrid-born López-Gallego) stretches and limps in pain for the duration of the film, using solid crutches. the clichés of the horror / thriller of the third millennium. The excess of naivety weighs down a very thin structure, which focuses entirely on the final revelation. A few minutes of explanation and only one, apocalyptic and worthy shot, to repay for too long a wait.

title: Alligator people
actors: Beverly Garland, Bruce Bennet, Lon Chaney jr.
description: A scientist attempts to heal the wounds of his patients by grafting a secretion of reptiles into the human skin. The result is literally monstrous: everyone undergoes mutations and goes to populate the swamps. Like a young doctor who transforms into a kind of caiman. The old "scientist" Lon Chaney in a typical 1950s B movie.

title: Haunting
actors: Liam Neeson, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Lili Taylor, Owen Wilson
description: Doctor Marrow, fascinated by what is said about Hill House, under the pretext of conducting scientific research on sleep disorders, gathers three young people in the house. Theo, an apparently self-confident researcher, Nell who proves to have particular psychic skills and the cynical Luke who does not believe in the experiments that the doctor is conducting. When ghosts begin to peep, terror spares no one.
notes: This film by Jan De Bont owes a lot to Roger Corman (which owes very little to Robert Wise's beautiful "Gli possati", if not the subject, inspired by the same novel). But Corman worked with stylization and profound irony and a disturbing vision of the subterranean things of the world in his films. Instead, De Bont works with spectacular emphasis and deep silky ghosts, footprints of bloody feet and a huge evil presence that seems to come out of "Fantasia". The special effects eat the soul of the film and turn it into a dizzying bandwagon.

title: Odd Thomas
actors: Anton Yelchin, Willem Dafoe, Addison Timlin, Ashley Sommers, Leonor Varela, Laurel Harris, Melissa Ordway, Gugu Mbatha-Raw, Shuler Hensley, Nico Tortorella, Matthew Page, Kyle McKeever
description: Despite striving to lead a normal existence, working in a fast food restaurant and having an affair with young Stormy (Addison Timlin), Odd Thomas (Anton Yelchin) cannot help but be visited by the deceased who are still unable to detach from earthly life. Between an appearance of Elvis Presley or one of Frank Sinatra, Odd sees above all the souls of those seeking the resolution of the crimes of which he has been the victim or of those who predict future episodes of violence. But when a stranger arrives in the city surrounded by sinister shadows, all that the spirits will provide will be just a date and the boy will have little time to find out what tragedy he will have to avoid.
notes: Dramaturgical repetitions, announced twists, inconsistencies in staging and antiquated superhero / action grammars carried out between slow motion struggles alternating with rapid scrolling, freeze frames and digital video game explosions from the 90s. A full-blown stock fund, good only for fill a lean distributive summer. Freely based on the novel of the same name by the writer Dean Koontz.

title: Today You Die
actors: Steven Seagal, Sarah Buxton, Nick Mancuso, Robert Miano
description: Harlan Banks is a sort of modern Robin Hood: he works with highly technological tools and "steals" from the rich to "give" to the poor. But when his latest heist goes wrong and ends in tragedy, the man flees to Las Vegas. There, his girlfriend Jada awaits him and persuades him to find a real honest job. And so he drives an armored car on behalf of the shady Max. But one day Harlan, while driving the vehicle, finds himself involved in a chase on the Strip, which ends in a shooting and the capture of the new driver from part of the police. Harlan will manage to escape and will track down Max who framed him.

title: Redemption
actors: Don 'The Dragon' Wilson, Chris Penn, James Russo, Sam J. Jones
description: Officer John Sato, leader of a Los Angeles police assault team, is held responsible for the death of a colleague in the course of an action. Expelled from the body and disgraced, John goes to the employ of the gangster Tony Leggio ...
notes: "For fans only": the others carefully keep away.

title: Grandma's House
actors: Eric Foster, Kim Valentine, Len Lesser, Ida Lee, Brinke Stevens, Michael Robinson, Craig Yerman, David Donham, Joan-Carol Bensen, Angela O'Neill
description: Rimsti without parents after the death of his father (his mother had passed away years earlier), the teenager Lynn and her little brother David go to live with their grandparents, on a farm near a vast orange grove. During the bus ride a mysterious woman stands in the middle of the road and almost ends up run over; the same lady reappears near the farm during the night. David witnesses his murder by his grandfather, who then takes the body to the cellar, where the child follows him but ends up being discovered ...
notes: On paper it may appear full of mysteries, dream sequences and twists, but in reality it is only patched up at least badly.

title: Raise the Titanic!
actors: Jason Robards, Richard Jordan, David Selby, Alec Guinness, Anne Archer, Bo Brundin, M. Emmet Walsh, J.D. Cannon, Norman Bartold
description: To carry out an elaborate nuclear defense project, the United States is committed to tracing the reserves of a very rare mineral discovered in 1910 on an island near the Arctic Circle. But it turns out that the fields are depleted and, moreover, the Russians are also interested in the operation. By a series of lucky coincidences, it turns out that 300 kilos of this "notorious" mineral sank along with the Titanic. And so the frantic and frantic searches begin, on the verge of armed conflict ...
notes: Laughable subject with dialogues that are ridiculous for an adventure film. The film originally ran 122 minutes. Also known as "Recover the Titanic".

title: Island of Lost Souls
actors: Charles Laughton, Richard Arlen, Leila Hyams, Bela Lugosi, Kathleen Burke, Arthur Hohl, Stanley Fields, Paul Hurst, Hans Steinke, Tetsu Komai
description: Following a shipwreck, Parker is rescued from a freighter carrying exotic animals bound for a small island where Dr. Moreau lives and works, a scientist banished from London for his delusions of grandeur and the immoral experiments he conducts to give life to creatures half men and half beasts. Believing that sooner or later another American ship can bring him home, Parker remains on the island ignoring that Moreau has a plan to use him as a guinea pig with the exotic Lota, the panther woman he himself generated. Meanwhile, on the mainland, Ruth, Parker's girlfriend, begins to worry about his absence and begins a frantic search that will lead her to the island when all creatures have decided to rebel against Moreau's overwhelming power.

title: Insidious: Chapter 2
actors: Rose Byrne, Patrick Wilson, Barbara Hershey, Lin Shaye, Angus Sampson, Leigh Whannell, Ty Simpkins, Steve Coulter, Danielle Bisutti, Tom Fitzpatrick, Garrett Ryan, Michael Beach, Jocelin Donahue
description: The haunted Lambert family tries to uncover the mysterious childhood secret that has left them dangerously connected to the spirit world.
notes: James Wan plays with his filmography and with the viewer's gaze as if they were his child prodigy toys. And he does it quite well. More than a sequel in the classic sense, "Beyond the Borders of Evil - Insidious 2" ("Chapter 2" of the original title is more effective) stands towards the first "Insidious" as a board game expansion. Looting "The Shining" (with almost literal quotes) and "Psyco" with aplomb, this sequel is a breakneck ride in a terrifying (albeit less than the previous film) and hilarious (much more) funfair.

title: Tarzan Finds a Son!
actors: Maureen O'Sullivan, Johnny Weissmuller, Johnny Sheffield, Ian Hunter

title: Hatari!
actors: John Wayne, Elsa Martinelli, Gérard Blain, Hardy Krüger, Red Buttons, Bruce Cabot, Michèle Girardon, Valentin de Vargas, Eduard Franz
description: In Tanganyika, at Brenda's farm, a group of hunters embark on a safari. Together with them also a lovely Italian photojournalist, Anna. The capture of the animals will serve to supply the best zoos in the world. The two women become the protagonists of sentimental skirmishes. In the end, between one hunt and another, the respective loves will come to the right conclusion.
notes: The great Howard Hawks ("Susanna", "A Dollar of Honor") grappling with a wide-ranging adventure in which he can best combine dramatic tones and comedy. Hunting scenes almost all shot from life.

title: Casanova
actors: Heath Ledger, Jeremy Irons, Charlie Cox, Lena Olin, Sienna Miller, Stephen Greif
description: Casanova falls in love with the beautiful Venetian Francesca, who rejects him. While the Inquisition is on his trail to arrest him, Casanova tries in every way to approach Francesca ...
notes: The 1950s air of the film evokes more _The Adventures of Giacomo Casanova_ di Steno than Fellini's obscure eighteenth century. After his "authorial" beginnings (_My life on all fours, _Happy birthday Mr. Grape_), Hallström has unfortunately got stuck in the recent "European-flavored" Hollywood cinema, which is a far more deadly trap than Hollywood escape cinema. So he takes himself a little too seriously, failing to be light and have fun all the way.

title: Mulberry Street
actors: Nick Damici, Kim Blair, Ron Brice, Bo Corre, Tim House, Larry Fleischman, Larry Medich, Javier Picayo, Antone Pagan, John Hoyt
description: An ordinary day in Manhattan, along Mulberry Street. The TV announces with concern an invasion of rats in the sewers; rodents begin to spread a disease that turns humans into zombies.

title: Hero and the Terror
actors: Chuck Norris, Jack O'Halloran, Brynn Thayer, Jeffrey Kramer
description: Nothing to say about detective O'Brien: he's a tough guy who knows his job well. Even if he's not the same since the time he managed to put Simon Moon, a multi-murderous psychopath, also known as "the Terror", in jail. Since that day O'Brien suffers from nightmares and is no longer able to sleep like he used to and, now that Simon has escaped from the criminal asylum, he risks not sleeping at all. The result is mediocre, but with Norris there is nothing to be done. He works in obtusely action roles, but never make him play a cop with inner worries. The very fact that he is capable of thinking is hardly credible.

title: Crimson Peak
actors: Mia Wasikowska, Jessica Chastain, Tom Hiddleston, Charlie Hunnam, Burn Gorman, Jim Beaver, Javier Botet, Kimberly-Sue Murray, Emily Coutts
description: In the aftermath of a family tragedy, an aspiring writer is torn between love for her childhood friend and the temptation of a mysterious stranger. Trying to escape the ghosts of her past, however, she will remain anchored to a house that breathes, bleeds and struggles to forget.
notes: Crimson Peak is not only a tribute to the Gothic, but also and above all a political rewriting of a codified canon with strongly hallucinatory hues that lead us to think of Roger Corman's Poe cycle.

title: Transit
actors: Jim Caviezel, Diora Baird, James Frain, Harold Perrineau, Elisabeth Röhm, Sterling Knight, Beau Brasseaux, Jake Cherry, Ryan Donowho, Robbie Jones
description: After being arrested for tax evasion, Nate Sidwell lost the respect of his wife and children. To rediscover the harmony of the past, he suggests they go camping, starting with their SUV. Shortly after departure, Nate is stopped by the police and forced to spend a night in a cell for reckless driving. As the journey resumes, the Sidwells realize that this is just the beginning of a long odyssey. In their trunk they discover a bag containing 4 million dollars of unknown origin and belonging to four ruthless killers already on their trail.

title: Extreme Honor
actors: Dan Andersen, Michael Ironside, Olivier Gruner, Michael Madsen
description: John Kennedy Brascoe is a Navy S.E.A.L. who, following a CIA operation that ended badly, is falsely accused of treason by one of his comrades. Forced into retirement to avoid trial, he finds himself in serious financial trouble when his son's cancer threatens to enter its terminal stage. The millionaire Baker offers a mountain of money to the man who manages to break into a high security fortress, and John is forced to accept the challenge, flanked by some scammers. He will end up confronting those responsible for his own fall from grace.
notes: Trivial action movie, with very little action, aimed at the home video market.

title: Hero Wanted
actors: Cuba Gooding jr., Ray Liotta, Norman Reedus, Kim Coates, Tommy Flanagan, Jean Smart, Christa Campbell
description: After saving a little girl's life during a fire, garbage man Liam has become an important and well-known character. But the quarter of an hour of fame passes quickly: and when he realizes that everyone has forgotten about him, he decides to stage a fake bank robbery in order to play the part of the hero again. Unfortunately, however, this time nothing goes according to plan and Liam finds himself the victim of a ruthless game. Deceived, cheated and blinded by the desire for revenge, he now has only one goal: to punish those who betrayed him, without any mercy, and is willing to do anything to succeed in his intent ...
notes: Ordinary administration.

title: Python
actors: Robert Englund, Casper Van Dien, Frayne Rosanoff, William Zabka
description: John returns to New Haven to help his mother run the metalworking factory. Meanwhile, a military truck in which snakes were traveling, has an accident near the town. The reptiles, escaped from the vehicle and come into contact with the factory's acids, sow death.

title: White Zombies
actors: Bela Lugosi, Madge Bellamy, Robert Frazer, Brandon Hurst
description: Falling in love with the beautiful Madeleine, the rich Beaumont convinces the young woman and her betrothed to celebrate the wedding in his villa in Haiti. To get Madeleine, Beaumont turns to the sorcerer Legendre, who transforms the girl into a zombie with his voodoo practices. Beaumont tries to rebel against Legendre to get Madeleine back alive, but by then it will be too late.
notes: In the US, a horror classic, it is considered the first zombie film in the history of cinema. Its strengths are above all the interpretation of Bela Lugosi, and his legendary close-ups with the spirited gaze, the settings and certain atmospheres that refer directly to German expressionism.

title: Tron Legacy
actors: Jeff Bridges, Garrett Hedlund, Olivia Wilde, Michael Sheen, John Hurt, Serinda Swan, Beau Garrett, Amy Esterle, Bruce Boxleitner
description: Sam Flynn (Garrett Hedlund) investigates the disappearance of his father Kevin (Jeff Bridges), whom he hasn't seen in 25 years. The truth is more incredible than you can imagine: Kevin is a prisoner of a virtual reality animated by gladiator games. A fantastic but dangerous world in which even Sam finds himself catapulted: from that moment father and son have to face a desperate journey to escape from cyberspace and return to the real universe.
notes: The promises are largely kept, but the banality and the jams of the script are also accentuated by the first film. Impressive are the sinister and rejuvenated Jeff Bridges, Michael Sheen who dances and kills like a glam rock star and the sinuous Olivia Wilde and Beau Garrett. Too bad that two hours are too long and flow like the update of a glorious but old program.

title: The Expendables
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Mickey Rourke, Jason Statham, Jet Li, Dolph Lundgren, Eric Roberts, Bruce Willis, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Steve Austin, David Zayas, Randy Couture, Giselle Itié, Charisma Carpenter, Gary Daniels, Terry Crews
description: A group of mercenaries travel to South America on an extreme mission that aims to overthrow a dictatorship.
notes: It is not just the jam session of a man who inaugurated his late autumn walking with his head held high on the long path of a twilight that shines like an aurora. The mercenaries is above all the proud and humble affirmation at the same time of a melancholy and self-deprecating poetic (the cameo of Schwarzy and Willis is a scream).

title: Jenifer
actors: Steven Weber, Carrie Fleming, Branda James, Harris Allan
description: A policeman saves a young woman who is about to be massacred by a guy: her name is Jenifer, she has a wonderful body and a scary face. The detective takes her home, where the girl freaks out: he tears the cat to pieces, makes his wife and son run away and finally seduces the man, who enters a vortex of perdition ...
notes: The ending is very easy to guess, and it is usually irritating - when it comes to Argento - the excessive suspension of credulity that the script demands. However _Jenifer_ is the best thing our has achieved in the last two decades: horror and involvement are finally well balanced. Episode of the series _Masters of Horror_.

title: Back in Business
actors: Brian Bosworth, Joe Torry, Dara Tomanovich, Brion Jones, Alan Scarfe
description: Joe Elkhart, engaged in a secret operation on behalf of the FBI, was a policeman before being set up and having his badge collected. The official purpose of the mission he is taking part in is to defeat a drug trafficking organization. In reality, the real target of the action is a group of corrupt cops. Among them there are also those who had framed him and therefore Joe will be forced to sell his life dearly.
notes: To be an action movie there is very little. If you then add a Brian Bosworth to the limit of his acting possibilities, you understand what film it is.

title: El Condor
actors: Jim Brown, Lee Van Cleef, Marianna Hill, Patrick O'Neal, Iron Eyes Cody, Imogen Hassall, Elisha Cook jr., Gustavo Rojo, Florencio Amarilla, Julio Peña, Ángel del Pozo
description: Lute, a young black escaped from a US penitentiary takes refuge in Mexico, where the revolution is raging. Having met an adventurer who calls himself El Condor, Lute proposes to him the attack on a fortress where the treasure of Emperor Maximilian is kept. The fortress is conquered, but a nasty surprise awaits the winners of the battle.
notes: Nothing new under the (Mexican) sun; the film follows very exploited patterns even if it is quite compelling, especially for those who like strong scenes of violence.

title: Shaft in Africa
actors: Richard Roundtree, Vonetta McGee, Frank Finley, Neda Arneric
description: The son of an emir investigates a slave trade that takes place between Africa and France. The young man just got his hands on important clues when he is killed. His father entrusts the research and revenge to the African American detective John Shaft. He manages to board the ship that transports the poor wretches. Thanks to the help of the beautiful Jazar, Shaft arrives, among many dangers, at the heart of the organization ...
notes: Hero of blaxploitation, Shaft rises here almost to a mythical figure, making an impossible historical redemption of black people. Good idea, but management is a mediocre adventure. Last cinematic chapter before the Singleton remake.

title: Plunder of the Sun
actors: Glenn Ford, Diana Lynn, Patricia Medina, Francis L. Sullivan

title: Devil Winds
actors: Joe Lando, Nicole Eggert, Peter Graham-Gaudreau, Erica Parker
description: Pete Jensen is a brilliant and ambitious meteorologist, specializing in the study of natural catastrophic phenomena. Until one of these destroys his life: a gigantic tornado hits his house and, while his daughter is saved by a miracle, his wife is killed. Shaken by the tragedy, Jensen walks away and throws himself headlong into work neglecting the child. Years later he finally returns to his small town in Oklahoma where he meets his friend and colleague Brooker. A new storm of frightening proportions is about to hit the area: for them and the enterprising reporter Julia Merrow a fight against time begins to try to save the inhabitants from imminent danger.

title: Fort Dobbs
actors: Clint Walker, Virginia Mayo, Brian Keith
description: Wanted for murder, Davis manages to escape by taking refuge in the territory of the Comanches. Here he collects a woman with her child on an isolated farm and arrives at Fort Dobbs after various adventures. But the fort is half-destroyed and the arrival of the soldiers is immediately followed by that of the Indians who begin the siege. A decent western starring Brian Keith more famous on television than in cinema.

title: Open Range
actors: Robert Duvall, Kevin Costner, Annette Bening, Michael Gambon, Michael Jeter, Diego Luna
description: Charley Waite, Boss Spearman, "Button" and Mose Harrison are on the run from their past: the only place where they feel truly free is the boundless plains of the West, where nature dictates the law. Champions of just causes, the four cowboys try to avoid violence: but a frontier town ruled by fear and tyranny will change their lives and force them into action ...
notes: A film that delights in its slowness, its pauses on the details of the scenes and the script, the rain that wets the prairies, the hats, the men and the herds, the mud that sticks to the boots and soils the deeds of a people with a short history. A people who at the cinema do not have the memory to sing chivalrous deeds or to write epic poems and which looks up, towards the great sky, or in front of itself towards unexplored borders. The West of Costner is inhabited by wolves, by Indians, by the last cowboys (who can also be ruthless). A land where no man can tell another man what to do: Ford and Mann, Boetticher and Hawks have explained it well.

title: Hideous!
actors: Michael Citriniti, Rhonda Griffin, Mel Johnson jr., Jacqueline Lovell
description: A man supervising the sewage system finds a deformed fetus underground. The strange "creature" is sold to a trafficker who gives it to a collector. On the way home, the collector is robbed of the "precious" purchase from a rival. With the help of a private detective, the robbed along with the trafficker and her secretary penetrates the thief's castle, where, in the meantime, the deformed fetus, endowed with extraordinary abilities, has managed not only to animate, but even to animate the others. fetuses present in the thief's collection.
notes: The film has interesting ideas but is lacking in tension.

title: Day of the Outlaw
actors: Robert Ryan, Burl Ives, Tina Louise, Nehimiah Persoff, Jack Lambert
description: The Bhrun gang terrifies and conditions the existence of the town where Blaise, a ranch owner, lives. Who, forced to lead Bhrun and his people towards a pass, actually leads the bandits to a mountainous and inhospitable area.
notes: A series B western perhaps not too original, but with a fair proof of direction

title: Lion Strike
actors: Don 'The Dragon' Wilson, Bobbie Phillips, Morgan Honier, Robert Costanzo
description: A doctor decides to go and spend a rest period with his little son in a mountain resort. At first everything seems to be going well: the stay is restful and mother and son end up under the "protective" wing of a charming forester which only makes their excursions more interesting. But the holiday turns into a nightmare when they are attacked by a group of killers perfectly trained in the manhunt even in winter and in the middle of the forest. "The newest race of Evil, meets the oldest race of heroes. ", said the advertisement for this film. And indeed, although unknown to most, Don "the Dragon" Wilson has been making films for a lifetime. All strictly the same and disappointing.

title: Wild Bill
actors: Jeff Bridges, Ellen Barkin, David Arquette, John Hurt, Diane Lane, Keith Carradine
description: The famous James Butler Hickok, known throughout the West as "Wild Bill", has to face an unexpected cat to peel: in fact, the young Jack McCall, who has sworn to kill him to wash the shame suffered, has set himself on his trail by his mother Susannah. The woman's life had been destroyed after Bill's abandonment, and Jack intends to do justice: the hero's descending parable and his passion for opium could facilitate the aspiring avenger's task ...
notes: After "Geronimo", Hill remains close to the myths of the Frontier addressing them with a vaguely "seventies" look, abounding in flashbacks and nostalgic notations.

title: Nightmares
actors: Emilio Estevez, Lance Henriksen, Veronica Cartwright, Cristina Raines, Richard Masur, Joe Lambie, Anthony James, Clare Nono, Raleigh Bond, Robert Phelps, Dixie Lynn Royce, Lee Ving, Mariclare Costello
description: Four episodes: a woman goes shopping at night, blissfully ignoring the presence of a fugitive killer; a computer genius' obsession with a video game leads him to the shocking discovery that reality is not what he thought; a disillusioned priest leaves the city and realizes he is being chased by a mysterious black pick-up; family members discover that the problem with mice is more serious than they thought.
notes: The four segments, directed by television director Joseph Sargent, do not shine for originality but are dignified, without much bloodshed but all characterized by a passable final revelation.

title: Maiden Voyage
actors: Casper Van Dien, Peter Elliott, Christopher Stollery, Danielle Cormack
description: Kyle Considine, a former police officer, is a consultant for a security company. His boss, Trevor, entrusts him with the task of taking care of the security service of a cruise ship. Since the assignment doesn't seem too demanding or dangerous, Kyle brings with him the 16-year-old son with whom he has had a stormy relationship since his divorce from his wife. As soon as the ship sails, however, a group of ferocious terrorists, captained by Damien, take the ship's three hundred passengers hostage and demand fifteen million dollars in exchange for their release. But they did the math without our man ...

title: The Ox-Bow Incident
actors: Henry Fonda, Dana Andrews, Anthony Quinn, Henry Morgan
description: In a small Nevada village, three men are wrongly accused of stealing cows. Without giving them the opportunity to defend themselves and despite the opposition of two cowboys, the three alleged thieves are executed on the gallows. The next day it turns out that they were innocent.
notes: In 1943 Wellman created the neo-western in one fell swoop by sewing the stylistic codes of what would be defined as the realist western around a story of intolerance. Based on a short story by Walter Van Tilburg, scripted by Lamar Trotti, with the exteriors shot in the studio due to production cuts, this film is a relentless and cruel account of the Umanian psychology on the borders of the frontier.

title: Captain Blood
actors: Errol Flynn, Olivia de Havilland, Basil Rathbone, Lionel Atwill, Ross Alexander, Guy Kibbee, Henry Stephenson, Robert Barrat, Hobart Cavanaugh
description: Sentenced to exile for treating some rebels, the English doctor Peter Blood is sold as a slave. But the captivity does not last long. Having become captain of a pirate ship, he wreaks havoc on the seas. He then saved the island of Port Royal from the siege of enemies and became its governor.
notes: Genuine swashbuckling with genre specialist Michael Curtiz (the Hungarian American Mihali Kertész who would direct the cult movie "Casablanca") and an "all-star" cast.

title: 5 Card Stud
actors: Dean Martin, Robert Mitchum, Inger Stevens, Roddy McDowall
description: During a game of poker, a player accused of cheating is lynched; later the other players are mysteriously killed one after the other. Curious suspense western, not one of the best directed by Hathaway.

title: The Sand Pebbles
actors: Steve McQueen, Richard Attenborough, Candice Bergen, Marayat Andrienne
description: The American gunboat San Pablo is anchored on the banks of the Yang-Tze. It is 1926: Chinese nationalists and communists are fighting against Western colonialism. Holman antagonizes the ship's Chinese personnel and is then wrongly found guilty of the death of a woman. Disgusted by the general situation, Holman wants to desert, but ends up dying as a hero defending the local mission.
notes: Three-hour colossal handled with confident hand and beautiful photography by Robert Wise. There is no shortage of spectacular sequences. The work of the interpreters is of good quality.

title: xXx
actors: Vin Diesel, Samuel L. Jackson, Asia Argento, Marton Csokas
description: Xander Cage, a young specialist in extreme sports, is recruited by the US government for a special mission. His job is to gather information about an organization that is planning the destruction of the world, under the leadership of the fearsome Yorgi.
notes: The most truzzo film of recent years is all built on the physicality of Vin Diesel who has a fundamental characteristic in order not to be detested: irony. Rob Cohen has a lot of work and in the unbearable pounding of the decibels he manages to insert some pretty good action sequences (above all, avalanche snowboarding). He would be a great candidate for directing a 007.

title: Color Me Blood Red
actors: Gordon Oas-Heim, Candi Conder, Elyn Warner, Pat Lee, Jerome Eden
description: An eccentric artist, Adam Sorg, finds the right color in human blood to paint his pictures. After using his own, he decides to procure the raw material by carrying out a series of heinous murders.

title: Showdown at Abilene
actors: Jock Mahoney, David Janssen, Martha Hyer, Lyle Bettger
description: A veteran of the Civil War, on his return he finds his girlfriend married and grudgingly accepts a post as sheriff. A restless and interesting low-cost western.

title: The Mad Love
actors: Colin Clive, Peter Lorre, Frances Drake, Isabel Jewell, Ted Healy
description: A famous pianist loses his hand in an accident. A mad surgeon (Peter Lorre), in love with the unfortunate's wife, grafts a limb taken from the corpse of a criminal. The results are unexpected and shocking.
notes: Grand Guignolesco and absurd little masterpiece directed by Karl Freund, already legendary director of photography (expressionist) of Murnau and Lang. As always, Peter Lorre is a perfect criminal: he rolls his eyes uncertain, looks shy and awkward only to reveal his true soul of the character. To represent evil he was undoubtedly the most suitable interpreter.

title: Boogeyman
actors: Eddie McClintock, Amy Bailey, Maya Angelova, Christian Hammerdorfer, Danny Horn, Cindy R. Johnson, Adriana Kalcheva, Emilia Klayn, Vladimir Koev, Boyan Levchev
description: Wandering around an old building known to be inhabited by a disturbed old man, a gang of young people accidentally unleashes a threat trapped there for decades. The black man, the legendary monster, returns free and determined to find a new guardian, spreading terror to the city.

title: The Cell
actors: Jennifer Lopez, Vince Vaughn, Vincent D'Onofrio, Marianne Jean-Baptiste
description: Catherine Deane is a psychologist who is experimenting with a new therapy: entering another person's unconscious and living the experiences that take place in his brain. Thanks to this technique, Catherine was able to save a child from a coma and brought him back to life and to his parents. When a serial killer falls into a coma, while one of his victims is imprisoned in a small, hidden cell full of traps, FBI agent Peter Novak turns to her in an attempt to save the life of the predestined victim.
notes: Sample of images and movements and effects of a supreme advertiser, "The Cell" is also a sample of citations, first of all visual but also cinematographic and literary. It refers to "The Silence of the Lambs", but with parapsychology and science fiction to cheat the genre.

title: Souls at Sea
actors: Gary Cooper, George Raft, Frances Dee, Henry Wilcoxon
description: Towards the middle of the nineteenth century, an English sailor fought with all his might against slavery, declared illegal by the British crown, out of a humanitarian spirit. For this he is hired by the secret services who entrust him with the mission of intercepting a large cargo en route to America. On the ship he meets a girl, with whom he falls in love, the sister of an officer involved in traffic. Due to a misunderstanding he ends up on trial, but the happy end is only postponed.
notes: Dear, good old Hollywood, with its stars of perpetual charm, the races on the seas, a rhythm to the story that never misses a beat and many good luxury craftsmen behind the camera.

title: Fatal Instinct
actors: Richard Burgi, Drew Fuller, Ivan Sergei, Dominique Swain, Krista Allen, Masiela Lusha, Anne Winters, Peter Dobson, Brittany Wagner, Kovar McClure
description: Police detectives Decker and Gates follow a trail of tracks as they hunt down a serial killer who is terrorizing Los Angeles. The investigation, however, turns out to be very personal and takes a turn for the worse when the evidence leads to Gates' crook brother, whom Decker helped get arrested years earlier.

title: The Old Ways
actors: Brigitte Kali Canales, Andrea Cortés, Julian Lerma, Sal Lopez, Julia Vera
description: Cristina, a journalist of Mexican descent, travels to the land of her ancestors, Veracruz, to investigate a story involving witchcraft and magical healers. Once there, she is kidnapped by a group of locals who claim that, as possessed by the devil, she needs an exorcism. As she tries to escape from a nightmare situation, Cristina slowly begins to believe that her captors may be right.

title: Wrong Turn 6
actors: Sadie Katz, Anthony Ilott, Aqueela Zoll, Rollo Skinner, Roxanne Pallett, Bobby Campo, Rhys Coiro, Chris Jarvis, Brian Boland, Talitha Luke-Eardley
description: A sudden and mysterious inheritance takes Danny and his friends to Hobb Springs, a forgotten village deep in the hills of West Virginia. The place is under the watchful eye of Jackson and Sally, a socially awkward couple who take Danny to family never known before: the Hillicker clan. Soon, the young man discovers that the relatives for generations have their own way of life far from all normality and linked to ancient traditions of cannibalism. Tempted by the forbidden, he will have to choose between the lives of his friends and his offspring, with all the horror that this entails.

title: Capricorn One
actors: Elliott Gould, James Brolin, Karen Black, Brenda Vaccaro, Sam Waterston, O.J. Simpson, Hal Holbrook, Telly Savalas, David Huddleston
description: After the conquest of the Moon, the American space agency is planning a mission to Mars. At the last moment, however, the astronauts already settled are brought down and taken to a secret military base in the Nevada desert: something went wrong and the mission was canceled. For public opinion, however, everything must remain unchanged, on pain of the loss of prestige of the nation. The astronauts are then forced to simulate, as on a movie set, a false landing on the Red Planet. On "return", however, the simulation also goes wrong and the missile disintegrates. What to do with the three "space heroes" now dead for everyone? Fortunately, a reporter caught the scam and some suspicious "incidents" put him on the right track.
notes: Under the guise of a science fiction film, Hyams touches on a delicate subject: reason of state. Not to mention the ever-present theme of the image (that of every staging) which confers truth even to the unreal. Hyams confirms himself as a good author, particularly skilled in measuring the pace of action. Together with the subsequent "Atmosfera zero" and "Timecop" this film constitutes an ideal fantastic trilogy.

title: Three Young Texans
actors: Mitzi Gaynor, Keefe Brasselle, Jeffrey Hunter
description: The three guys in the title are actually two guys and a girl. Friends for the skin the young men and both naturally in love with the girl. She is undecided in the choice and therefore puts herself at the disposal of the one who will be able to put together a fair sum. In the ensuing struggle, there will be trouble in sight for the two boys.
notes: Naive and enjoyable western for teenagers.
